issueDTO.title: [MCP] APITemplate.io
issueDTO.description:
## 🧩 Product Overview

APITemplate.io is a dynamic document automation platform that generates PDFs and images (e.g., banners, infographics, QR codes) from templates and JSON data.  
This integration empowers AI agents and workflows to create and manage templated media assets automatically.

---

## ?????? Important Note for Contributors

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

**Contributors based in India: please check your eligibility for receiving payments through your Stripe account before submitting, as this may affect your ability to get paid.**

---

## 🛠??? Write Actions

| **Action Item**                 | **Use Case** |
|----------------------------------|--------------|
| **Create Image**                | Generate an image from a template using JSON overrides (supports dynamic elements such as QR codes). |
| **Create PDF**                  | Generate a PDF using a template and JSON input. |
| **Create PDF From HTML**        | Generate a PDF from raw HTML (e.g., invoices built via custom HTML). |
| **Create PDF From URL**         | Generate a PDF from an external URL (e.g., archiving web content). |
| **Create PDF (Advanced)**       | Generate a PDF with custom filename, CMYK/color settings, resolution, and template options. |
| **Delete Object**               | Delete a generated image or PDF (cleanup old outputs). |
| **Get Account Information**     | Retrieve account details such as usage limits and template quotas. |

---

## 🔍 Search Actions

| **Action Item**        | **Use Case** |
|------------------------|--------------|
| **List Objects**       | List previously generated images or PDFs. |

---

## 📚 API Reference

- [API Documentation](https://apitemplate.io/apiv2/)

---

## 🧪 Test Account Access

- You can test APITemplate.io APIs by signing up at [APITemplate.io](https://apitemplate.io/) and retrieving your API key from the dashboard.  


---

## 🧑???💻 New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are build with our TypeScript framework and are easy to build. Once they're merged to our repo, they will available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs to be used with AI agents and MCP clients.

We welcome contributions and in fact, we get excited over them. Start your journey here: https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview

issueDTO.title: Synchronize dependencies between Bifold and BC Wallet
issueDTO.description:
### Value
Keeping dependencies up to date fixes security vulnerabilities, prevents bugs, and improves performance. Synchronizing dependencies between the two repos has the added benefit of preventing unwanted regressions where an issue might be fixed in Bifold but break in BC Wallet, or vice versa. It's a small amount of work for a lot of gain

### Developer notes
Deps should be aligned between the two repos so that the whichever dep is newer in either is used in both, preferably updating to the latest patch version as well. ie: if one repo has `my-dep@3.4.1` and the other has `my-dep@4.0.0` then upgrade both to `my-dep@4.0.7` (assuming 4.0.7 is the latest patch version)

issueDTO.title: Separate financial statement
issueDTO.description:
Hi, thanks for developing such a great tool. I???ve noticed that some 10-K reports place their financial statements separately, meaning they are not located in Item 8 or Item 16. Instead, they are placed at the end of the 10-K report. Could you please extract this section and create a new item (perhaps called "financial_statement") in the extracted file for such cases?

I am aware that both types of financial statements usually start with "INDEX TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS" or "INDEX TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS." Maybe you can capture the section titled "INDEX TO * STATEMENTS" that appears after Item 16 and treat everything from that point to the end of the file as the financial statements section?

Here are a few examples:
ADT: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1703056/000170305624000020/adt-20231231.htm

ATUS: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1702780/000162828025005486/atus-20241231.htm
comments:
hi! thanks for the feedback. Indeed, I verify that I've seen this too. It does not happen always but it does happen sometimes.

Tbh, during this time period, I am busy with other stuff so I won't find time to contribute towards the software.

However, feel free to introduce any PR yourself if you want.

Some extra questions just to "pinpoint" this issue a bit better, so we understand the issue a bit better:
- When statements are not found in item 8/15 (or 16 as you say), they are then found at the end of the 10-k report? This translates to "after the end of item 15/16"? can you get a bit more specific? BTW, Item 16 is optional. 
- Let's also think the other way around. In 10-Ks where the parsing right now is succesful, if you would search for these phrases "INDEX TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS" or "INDEX TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.", would you get anything returned? The problem with mostly rule-based parsing is that it is a bit hard to generalize the code for rare cases like this, since there are chances you "break" the parsing for all the other filings (ofc this does not mean a fix isn't possible)

Hi, please see my comments below for your questions. 1. If the financial statement can not be found in item 8/15, then it mostly like can be found after the signature part. The signature always at the end of the 10-K report, that's why I said the financial report can be found at the end of the 10-K report. Please see below for an example. 2. I reviewed several reports and found that some "INDEX TO * STATEMENTS" sections indeed appear in item 8 or 15. Therefore, I believe it would be safer to extract the "INDEX TO * STATEMENTS" only if it appears after item 16. I also think this scenario is not uncommon; out of 490 tickers I downloaded, 90 fall into this case.

repository.description: The only open-source toolkit that can download SEC EDGAR financial reports and extract textual data from specific item sections into nice & clean structured JSON files. Presented at WWW 2025 @ Sydney, Australia (https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3701716.3715289)

summary.otherNotes: The issue is about extracting financial statements that are not located in Item 8 or Item 16, but instead are placed at the end of the 10-K report. The author suggests capturing the section titled "INDEX TO * STATEMENTS" that appears after Item 16 and treating everything from that point to the end of the file as the financial statements section.

issueDTO.title: Implement user authentication APIs including Signup and Login functionality using Node.js, Express, and MongoDB. This will allow users to register and securely log in using JWT-based authentication.
issueDTO.description:
## 🛠??? Feature Request: Login & Signup API

### 📌 Description

Implement user authentication APIs including **Signup** and **Login** functionality using **Node.js**, **Express**, and **MongoDB**. This will allow users to register and securely log in using JWT-based authentication.

---

### 📋 Requirements

1. **Signup API (`POST /api/v1/auth/signup`)**

   * Accepts `name`, `email`, and `password`
   * Validates existing user by email
   * Password should be hashed using `bcryptjs`
   * Returns JWT token and basic user info (e.g., name, id)

2. **Login API (`POST /api/v1/auth/login`)**

   * Accepts `email` and `password`
   * Checks if user exists and password matches
   * Returns JWT token and basic user info

---

### ??? Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] User can successfully register with unique email
* [ ] User gets a token upon successful signup
* [ ] User can log in with correct credentials
* [ ] Error messages for invalid inputs or existing users
* [ ] Secure password handling (bcrypt)
* [ ] JWT token generation with secret

---

### 📦 Tech Stack

* Node.js
* Express
* MongoDB (Mongoose)
* JWT
* bcryptjs

---

JWT-based authentication for secure login/register flows

Bcrypt to securely hash passwords, ensuring safe transmission and storage of sensitive user credentials.

Modular code structure with environment configuration, middleware, error handling, etc.

MongoDB/PostgreSQL integration depending on project needs

API documentation (Postman or Swagger) for easy consumption

I???ll make sure the codebase is clean, maintainable, and aligned with modern backend best practices.

issueDTO.title: Path subsitution
issueDTO.description:
### What would you like sesh to do?

As a user, I want to define global substitution rules, so I can create custom session name rules to improve my session names and create a more streamlined workflow.

# Example

- `~/c/dotfiles/.config/neovim` could be changed to `💻 neovim` (replacing `~/c/dotfiles/.config`)

```toml
[namer]
[[find_and_replace]]
find = "~/c/dotfiles/.config/"
replace = "💻 "
```
comments:
Hi @joshmedeski 

First off; thanks for providing sesh! It's been a great time saver within my workflow for some time now.

I'm planning on submitting a PR for this exact feature, but I'd want to discuss a few things:
- Should the "namer" only apply to i.E. zoxide items or all items? In my eyes, zoxide would benefit the most from this setting as I wouldn't want to accidentally rename any tmux or config defined sessions. Based on the decision I'd name the config field either `path_substitution` (if zoxide only) or `name_substitution` instead of `namer` (all)
- I'd support regular expressions out of the box by trying to create a regexp based on "find", if it fails I'd fall back to literal substitution.
- I'd add opt-in support for expanding env variables with `expand_env_vars = true` for portable configs (which could be useful for eg. `find = "$HOME/.local/share/git`)
- I'd add a `priority` field to control which substitution takes precedence (default `0`)

Let me know what you thought about the feature or if you have any other recommendations/ideas 😁

issueDTO.title: [feature request] Be more accurate with the color defined by the user for the background color of elements
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
For now, the background color (fill) is always the 6th color of the array generated by mantine.
Unfortunately, it rarely correspond to the color specified by the user, bringing to an inconsistent experience.

Exemple : 
Choosing #ffe0bd wil result in the following array :
[
  "#fff5e5",
  "#ffe0bd",
  "#fed19e",
  "#fdb769",
  "#fda13c",
  "#fd9422",
  "#fd8c14",
  "#e27907",
  "#c96b00",
  "#af5b00"
]

6th element is way darker the the original.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We could find the index of the specified value in the array and use it as the reference color for the backgoundn. We can then use surrounding ones for others attributes (stroke).
comments:
I think we don't need to rely on Mantine library for this one. The color palette generated by Mantine is too limited if the selected color is dark or light.

We could rely on chroma-js and generate the color we need with the brighten et darken functions.

- main color (or primary ?), use for the background color, should be the one defined by the user
- secondary color (stroke) could be darken by 0.8
- keep hiContrast and loContrast calculated as in #2100
- generate a light and dark colors to be used when readability is affected by the theme (when there is transparency principaly)

I'm divided between two solutions to manage light and dark colors. **1. Use two differents variables to store a light and adark value** In this solution we check the luminance of the main color. If the main color is already pretty light then light = main, dark = darken(main) If the main color is pretty dark then light = brighten(main), dark = main This solution avoid getting a light color equal to white or a dark color equal to dark if the main color is already in the extremes. But this solution implied to rely on javascript to calcultate the dark and light values instead of pure css and to use two different variables in light and dark themes. It could be less maintenable. **2. Use the main color and adjust the brightness and darkness with css** This solution avoid to maintain two different variables but is less accurate in the extremes color values. We don't check the luminance and the main color is always brighten or darken depending of the selected theme. Here is a comparison with a light color : Options 1 : Compound title and relationship from "GraphQL" stay light blue. There value is the same as the fill color of the element. Options 2 : Compound title and relationship from "GraphQL" become white because they have be lighten. We lose the blue tint on those elements. Enlarge the capture because the difference is subtil but noticeable :) @davydkov what do you think about it ?

Tried to push a branch before my vacations just to have a preview to play with
It's the "option 1" (that was my first attempt), . 
Unfortunately I have a "typecheck" error that I don't understand. 

See you !

repository.name: likec4

summary.validationOrRequirement: main color (or primary ?), use for the background color, should be the one defined by the user - secondary color (stroke) could be darken by 0.8 - keep hiContrast and loContrast calculated as in #2100 - generate a light and dark colors to be used when readability is affected by the theme (when there is transparency principaly)
summary.attemptedFixes: I think we don't need to rely on Mantine library for this one. We could use chroma-js and generate the color we need with the brighten et darken functions. issueDTO.title: [WASM] `SystemNavigationManager.BackRequested` doesn't work.
issueDTO.description:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://github.com/nventive/Uno/security/
-->

## Current behavior
I have written the following code.
The location is in the if block of the if(rootFrame == null) of the OnLanuched method in App.xaml.cs.
```
Windows.UI.Core.SystemNavigationManager.GetForCurrentView().BackRequested += (s, args) =>
{
    if (!rootFrame.CanGoBack)
    {
        return;
    }
    rootFrame.GoBack();
    args.Handled = true;
};
```
I deployed it to azure and tried it on my Android Chrome, but it didn't work.
I hit the back key on my Android after Navigate, resulting in the tab being closed.
Chrome on Android is the latest version. (81.0.4044.117)

The above code worked fine in builds for other platforms.(ex: UWP)

`[Wasm] Add support of hardware/browser back button in SystemNavigationManager.BackRequested`
It seems to be supported as of 1.45.
Is it not working properly now?

<!-- Describe how the issue manifests. -->

## Expected behavior

<!-- Describe what the desired behavior would be. -->
I want you to go back to the previous screen.

## How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)

<!-- Please provide a **MINIMAL REPRO PROJECT** and the **STEPS TO REPRODUCE**-->
I've already explained the code.

## Environment

<!-- For bug reports Check one or more of the following options with "x" -->

Nuget Package:Uno.UI

Package Version(s):2.3.0-dev.116

Affected platform(s):

- [ ] iOS
- [ ] Android
- [x] WebAssembly
- [ ] WebAssembly renderers for Xamarin.Forms
- [ ] macOS
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Build tasks
- [ ] Solution Templates

Visual Studio:

- [ ] 2017 (version: )
- [x] 2019 (version: )
- [ ] for Mac (version: )

Relevant plugins:

- [ ] Resharper (version: )

## Anything else we need to know?

<!-- We would love to know of any friction, apart from knowledge, that prevented you from sending in a pull-request -->
comments: It could be an issue with android, specifically. Does your sample work on a desktop machine ?

@jeromelaban 
No, it don't work on a desktop machine. (Windows10 Chrome 81.0.4044.129)

It does not work on desktop browsers for another reason.
The back button is inactive because no browser history has been added after the screen transition by the Navigate method. This means I can't hit the back button.
Originally, the Navigate method should create a browser history and allow you to hit the back button. Isn't it?

The Frame control never manipulates the back button, it's only done by the `Windows.UI.Core.SystemNavigationManager`.

If you want to enable the back button, you'll need to handle it explicitly, using [`AppViewBackButtonVisibility`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.ui.core.systemnavigationmanager.appviewbackbuttonvisibility?view=winrt-18362), as demonstrated [in this answer](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30597585/windows-10-uap-back-button/30607742#30607742).

@jeromelaban 
I don't have time today, so I will read it and test it out tomorrow.
Thank you for your quick response.
I will let you know the results.

@jeromelaban I added the following code and it worked fine on my smartphone. Thank you so much! `Windows.UI.Core.SystemNavigationManager.GetForCurrentView().AppViewBackButtonVisibility = AppViewBackButtonVisibility.Visible;` However, there were cases where it did not work properly on Windows Chrome. When debugging with IIS Express in VisualStudio, this is the case. I was able to fix this by using pushState to create a browser history. However, I don't think this is the right implementation. Is there a better way to do it? Here is the source code that I verified and the URL where I published it. https://unoplatformissues3115.azurewebsites.net/ [UnoPlatformIssues3115_code.zip](https://github.com/unoplatform/uno/files/4593690/UnoPlatformIssues3115_code.zip)

I am able to reproduce this by pinning the page to taskbar, closing browser and opening it from there. This starts the browser with no history and navigating to second page does not enable the back button.

Hey there ??? just a heads-up that this issue has been quiet for over a year. If there???s no update or comment in the next 10 days, it???ll be closed automatically. Feel free to remove the stale label or drop a note to keep it open.
Still relevant for skia wasm

summary.attemptedFixes: The author added the code Windows.UI.Core.SystemNavigationManager.GetForCurrentView().AppViewBackButtonVisibility = AppViewBackButtonVisibility.Visible; which worked fine on smartphone. Because I have the package installed and I've set `auth_manager = airflow.providers.fab.auth_manager.fab_auth_manager.FabAuthManager` in the `[core]` section of the config file but both `airflow users create` and `flask fab create-user` still fail.

No idea - works for me when I just set it - i guess some settings on your side are not applied in the container:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/da3f95df-1524-4ee5-a568-0d9c46e500d3)

Somehow reinstalling fixed it. Really not sure what was wrong in my first install. The only thing I changed was setting FAB as the auth manager in the Helm chart from the beginning (my first install was using SimpleAuth at first). 

Thanks!
It also failed for me when using the helm chart, in fact, it does not show up in airflow subcommands but fab is installed and used for Oauth against Azure. Very weird.

> It also failed for me when using the helm chart, in fact, it does not show up in airflow subcommands but fab is installed and used for Oauth against Azure. Very weird.

I think it depends on how you are running the `airflow` command and whether the container you are running it in has the FAB provider installed and FAB Auth manager configured. Can you check it ?

First of all, and as always thank you so much for Apache Airflow :), I've depended on it for years for many projects. And yes, as far as I can tell we do have it installed. Some "evidence" that may help, short of showing the running system. 1. I'm using a custom docker image (but based on apache/airflow:3.0.0-python3.12) that includes this in its requirements: **apache-airflow-providers-fab==2.0.1**. This is a gist with its definition and related files: https://gist.github.com/mrbungie/ab8e2a2104e56c7d6dc8872d01d44f9a 2. I'm setting the following relevant values in my helm chart: https://gist.github.com/mrbungie/eaae9aed11d04b04d960376788d3e91e (here im showing it with webserver.defaultUser = false, but when I set it to true, the createUser fails) 3. We implemented a webserver_config.py (shown in [1] gist integrated with EntraID). And it works, so FAB is working. When I get into most containers, they do have the users subcommand: But when checking the create-user container (after setting createUser to true), it fails. I'm pretty sure it has to do with the fact that the env vars overriding Auth are not reaching the createUser container. create-user envvars: Meanwhile other containers (like api-server) I guess that means that that setting (i.e. airflow.core.auth_manager / AIRFLOW__CORE__AUTH_MANAGER) **should be set exclusively via airflow.cfg**, but I think docs should be clearer about that. If that's not the hoped behaviour, I would guess AIRFLOW__CORE__AUTH_MANAGER, if set, should be propagated down into the create-user container (after all, if its going to run create-user in Airflow 3, it should have that set to FAB or it is always going to fail). Maybe the create-user container should check if FAB is on (via env var + airflow.cfg), and if not, it should just continue gracefully and maybe logging that so users are advised to set createUser = false if they are just using Simple Auth. If anything I'm saying makes sense, I can make a PR fixing this in some direction you propose. More info: Helm chart commit SHA256: https://github.com/apache/airflow/commit/3bd9746d5c30d47fec1e50cc95a3b83add1ee3e8

> If anything I'm saying makes sense, I can make a PR fixing this in some direction you propose.

Makes absolutely sense. Thanks for all those invstigations @mrbungie ! and Fix would be really nice!

From version>=3.0.0, no subcommand 'users'.

You would have to use airflow standalone, which also gets an error
@mrbungie may I ask how you added the `AIRFLOW__CORE__AUTH_MANAGER` env variable? Did you add it through the `extraEnv:`/`extraEnvFrom`, or through the `config.core:` section (or any other way)?
I'm looking into this issue and would like to contribute if it's still unresolved.

This happens because Airflow 3.x uses SimpleAuthManager as the default auth manager, which does not support the airflow users CLI command. Even if you try to use FabAuthManager, the system may override it back to SimpleAuthManager???especially in dev setups (like Breeze or standalone mode), where the environment is explicitly set or forced during container startup. To fix this and re-enable the users CLI, you need to explicitly set the following environment variable: export AIRFLOW__CORE__AUTH_MANAGER=airflow.providers.fab.auth_manager.fab_auth_manager.FabAuthManager and restarting the breeze environment

issueDTO.title: templ fmt does not indent style tag properly
issueDTO.description:
Say I have the following code
![CleanShot 2024-12-06 at 14 34 01](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b31500b0-f3d5-40d0-801a-0e0f27759904)

After running `templ fmt .` it will look like this.

![CleanShot 2024-12-06 at 14 38 16](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48103b64-8827-41c6-9db7-0968464710c0)

So the divs and such are are indented correctly, but the closing style tag with content is not.

Please let me know if more info is needed.
**`templ info` output**
![CleanShot 2024-12-06 at 14 40 20](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/992d898d-2d1e-4737-b3cb-ca69b3d95547)
comments: Happy to take this on.
I think this does the same thing with `<script>` tags - mainly the closing `</script>` tags.

So, you've probably figured out that `templ fmt` formats templ files by parsing a template file into an object model, then writing it back out again.

You can see that in action here: https://github.com/a-h/templ/blob/850120161a0434ee73b92810f02e4def8a70c850/cmd/templ/fmtcmd/main.go#L141-L166

Note that the `TemplateFile.Write` method writes the object model out: https://github.com/a-h/templ/blob/850120161a0434ee73b92810f02e4def8a70c850/parser/v2/types.go#L128-L150

So you can see that each `Node` gets written out in turn.

The script and style elements are parsed into the following types: https://github.com/a-h/templ/blob/850120161a0434ee73b92810f02e4def8a70c850/parser/v2/types.go#L669-L703

By this parsing code: https://github.com/a-h/templ/blob/850120161a0434ee73b92810f02e4def8a70c850/parser/v2/raw.go

I can see that the style and script tags don't populate out a `TrailingSpace`, like the other elements do: https://github.com/a-h/templ/blob/850120161a0434ee73b92810f02e4def8a70c850/parser/v2/elementparser.go#L496 

I think ths issue is probably:

  - Not parsing trailing whitespace into the object model, so it can't be retained properly.
  - Not writing out appropriate indentation in the `Write` method to ensure that the `</script>` / `</style>` element is properly indented.

Note that there's some formatting tests alonside the `templ fmt` command, so that's a good place to add test cases.

Hope that helps you track it down!

summary.main: The templ fmt does not indent style tag properly
summary.validationOrRequirement: The style tag is not indenting child nodes as expected, and its closing tag is not properly indented.
summary.attemptedFixes: The commenter has been trying to get a little more familiar with this issue, focusing efforts in generator.go around indent levels, and has been poking around for now but could probably use some confirmation they're at least looking in the right area.
summary.otherNotes: templ fmt formats templ files by parsing a template file into an object model, then writing it back out again. The issue is probably due to not parsing trailing whitespace into the object model, so it can't be retained properly. Not writing out appropriate indentation in the Write method to ensure that the </script> / </style> element is properly indented.

issueDTO.title: Airflow 3 select many runs and collectively remove failed tasks
issueDTO.description:
### Description

This was a useful feature in Airflow 2:

- From the runs page of a DAG, eg `https://myairflow/dags/<DAG-ID>/runs?state=failed`
- See the number of failed runs
- select all of them
- collectively clear the failed tasks

### Use case/motivation

I have many runs that failed and with some code change I only want to run the failed tasks. Currently I cannot easily see how many failed runs there are and to clear I have to go one-by-one

### Related issues

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: I support this, really miss this feature in Airflow 3 (both for (failed) dag runs and task instances, but primarily for dag runs.)
cc @bbovenzi @pierrejeambrun

Thanks for reporting, indeed that would be nice!

Adding good first issue + 3.1.0 target in hope that someone from the community can work on this. That would be a great addition to the next minor release. (If not I'll try to do it but considering other priorities I'm not sure I can get to it in time for 3.1.0)
Really miss this too. We also have cases where we want to clear all successful runs of a certain dag, because we want it reran retroactively for all time periods.

issueDTO.title: Analytics button in dashboard
issueDTO.description:
## Description 📹

Add a button on the dashboard page to access the analytics page.
The button should reuse the logic of the `/starky-analytics` command:

* It checks that the dashboard token is valid.
* It generates an analytics token.
* It stores this token in the database.
* It opens the analytics page using this generated token.

## Proposed Actions 🛠???

Here???s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:

```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
```

2. **Implement Changes**:

* [ ] Add a new button to the dashboard page UI to trigger analytics access.
* [ ] On click, reuse the `/starky-analytics` backend logic to:

  * [ ] Validate the current dashboard token.
  * [ ] Generate a new analytics token.
  * [ ] Store the token in the database.
* [ ] Redirect the user to the analytics page using the generated token.

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:

```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: Add analytics access button to dashboard with token generation"
```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

* **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren???t assigned to this issue.
* **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
* **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing Close #\[issue\_id].
* **Review Process**:

  * Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  * If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
* **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

?????? WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: `databricks fs cp` does not detect trailing slashes for file copy
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the issue
The following command should fail with a directory does not exist error:
```
databricks fs cp hello.txt dbfs:/Volumes/a/b/mydir/
```

if directory mydir does not exist. This would be consistent with how the Linux `cp` works.
```
% cp 0.json tmp/
cp: directory tmp does not exist
```

Instead, this command creates a file called mydir with the contents of hello.txt.

Another option is to transparently create mydir. The Files API has the behaviour that it is supposed to create directories that don???t exist when uploading a file. 

The cp should differentiate between whether the target is a file or a directory based on the trailing slash.

### Is this a regression?
No
comments:
Note, users can call the following command to be explicit as a workaround:
```
databricks fs cp hello.txt dbfs:/Volumes/a/b/mydir/hello.txt
```
This issue has not received a response in a while. If you want to keep this issue open, please leave a comment below and auto-close will be canceled.

summary.validationOrRequirement: trailing slash detection for file copy, differentiate between file and directory
summary.attemptedFixes: transparently create mydir
summary.otherNotes: Note, users can call the following command to be explicit as a workaround: databricks fs cp hello.txt dbfs:/Volumes/a/b/mydir/hello.txt

issueDTO.title: Support `environment` in the `provision` phase
issueDTO.description:
Please support to set environment in provision phase, so we can add something to test environment based on guest e.g.

```yaml
provision:
  - hardware:
      network:
        driver: ice
    environment:
      NIC_DRIVER: ice

  - hardware:
      network:
        driver: mlx5_core
    environment:
      NIC_DRIVER: mlx5_core
```

Related issues:

* https://issues.redhat.com/browse/TFT-3467
* https://issues.redhat.com/browse/TFT-3468
comments:
Probable steps involved:
1. modify tmt/schemas/provision/hardware.yaml to include `environment`
2. modify plans/main.fmf to include: 
```yaml
provision:
  - hardware:
      network:
        driver: ice
    environment:
      NIC_DRIVER: ice

  - hardware:
      network:
        driver: mlx5_core
    environment:
      NIC_DRIVER: mlx5_core
```
3. Update the signature of Phase.go() in the base class (and any subclasses) to accept an environment parameter: 
``` python
def go(self, guest, logger, environment=None):
    ...
```
4. Update the call to go() in run_on_guest()
    	```python
    	self.phase.go(guest=guest, logger=logger, environment=guest.environment)
    	```
5. Test that when a provision entry defines environment:, the environment variable is available

> * modify tmt/schemas/provision/hardware.yaml to include `environment`

The new `environment` key is not to be added under `hardware` specification but directly under `provision` step, both `environment` and `hardware` are on the same level.

> 2\. modify plans/main.fmf to include:

Yeah, something like this can be used in the new test coverage to exercise the new functionality. But not the main plan config file in the `tmt` repository.
Perfect - thanks @psss !

repository.name: tmt

Update the signature of Phase.go() in the base class (and any subclasses) to accept an environment parameter, 4. Update the call to go() in run_on_guest(), 5. Test that when a provision entry defines environment:, the environment variable is available

issueDTO.title: Time Series Support
issueDTO.description:
This issue is designed to track progress towards full time series support in TorchGeo. If you are interested in helping with this effort, please join the `#time-series` channel on [Slack](https://join.slack.com/t/torchgeo/shared_invite/zt-22rse667m-eqtCeNW0yI000Tl4B~2PIw) and attend our weekly meetings.

### Datasets

#### Required changes

- [x] Replace R-tree with geopandas: #2747
- [x] Spatial-only intersection: #2837
- [ ] Convert change detection datasets: #2862, #2863, #2878, #2879
- [ ] Convert time series datasets
- [ ] Return time series: #2308 
- [ ] Xarray support: #1490
- [ ] ERA5
- [ ] CMIP6
- [ ] WeatherBench
- [ ] Splitters: guarantee non-overlapping spatial and/or temporal splits
- [ ] Collation functions for padding

#### Desired changes

- [x] Replace BoundingBox with slicing: #2804
- [x] Support Polygon ROIs in all splitters: #2835
- [x] Deprecate BoundingBox: #2847
- [ ] Store true image footprint: #1881
- [ ] Properly handle vector datasets, drop fiona dependency: @isaaccorley
- [ ] Cache geopandas index: @isaaccorley
- [ ] Support integer indexing?: @adamjstewart
- [ ] Unify GeoDataset and NonGeoDataset?: #1353
- [ ] Intersection/Union multiple queries?: #2408
- [ ] Tuple/MultiQuery dataset?: #877

### Samplers

- [x] Support Polygon ROIs in all samplers: #2812
- [ ] Reimplement existing samplers
- [ ] Add new time series samplers: #877
- [ ] Ensure samplers do not sample outside Polygon bounds
- [ ] Support weighted samplers: #757

### Transforms

- [ ] B x T x C x H x W <-> B x TC x H x W: #2477 (TODO: image + mask)
- [ ] Temporal embeddings: #2826
- [ ] Temporal up/downsampling: @yichiac 
- [ ] UTC time <-> local time: @yichiac 
- [ ] Data imputation: @yichiac 

### Models

#### 1D

- [x] RNNs: LSTMs, GRUs
- [ ] Seq2Seq: #2639 
- [x] L-TAE: #2867
- [ ] TempCNN: https://github.com/charlotte-pel/temporalCNN
- [ ] Chronos: @cnagda?
- [ ] Galileo
- [ ] Presto: @cnagda?

#### 3D

- [x] Satlas
- [ ] ChangeViT: @hkristen
- [ ] Conv-LSTM: #2898
- [ ] CNN-LSTM
- [ ] AnySat
- [ ] OmniSat
- [ ] Prithvi v1, v2: @isaaccorley 
- [ ] SatMAE: @isaaccorley 
- [ ] SkySense v1, v2

#### 4D

- [ ] Aurora: #2823
- [ ] NeuralGCM: #2850
- [ ] Climate: @cnagda?

### Trainers

- [x] Change detection: #2422, #2890
- [ ] Autoregression: #2639
- [ ] Modify existing trainers: @keves1

### Documentation

- [ ] Crop type mapping tutorial: #2449 
- [ ] Change detection tutorial: @hkristen
- [ ] Air pollution tutorial
- [ ] Weather forecasting tutorial: @cnagda
- [ ] Climate modeling tutorial?: @cnagda

### Outdated discussions

- #640
- #1544

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to add time series support to TorchGeo, which includes adding support for time series datasets, samplers, transforms, models, trainers, and documentation.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The following requirements need to be met: replace R-tree with geopandas, spatial-only intersection, convert change detection datasets, convert time series datasets, return time series, Xarray support, ERA5, CMIP6, WeatherBench, splitters, and collation functions for padding. Additionally, the following desired changes need to be implemented: replace BoundingBox with slicing, support Polygon ROIs in all splitters, deprecate BoundingBox, and properly handle vector datasets.
summary.attemptedFixes: Several attempts have been made to add time series support, including replacing R-tree with geopandas, spatial-only intersection, and converting change detection datasets. However, there are still several blockers, including converting time series datasets, returning time series, and Xarray support.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is designed to track progress towards full time series support in TorchGeo. The main goal is to add time series support in various areas such as datasets, samplers, transforms, models, trainers, and documentation.

issueDTO.title: Fork, Commit, Merge - Easy Issue (MATLAB)

# Fork, Commit, Merge - Easy Issue (MATLAB)

## Create a MATLAB script that adds two numbers
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

### How to get started

Navigate to the `tasks/matlab/easy` directory from the root of your project.
Then open a file called `addition.m` and start implementing your solution!

### Description

MATLAB is primarily used as a desktop application, and VS Code doesn't run MATLAB directly. However, you can use VS Code as an editor for MATLAB scripts. Issue for this task is to create a simple MATLAB script that adds two numbers and prints the result.

### How to run

To test the program you have to first make sure you are in the right directory:
```bash
cd tasks/matlab/easy
```

Run the program with the command:
```bash
matlab -r addition.m
```

If the program works as requested in the task, you are ready to make a pull request!

---

To work with this issue, you need to have MATLAB installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing MATLAB and how to make a pull request.

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

#### Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!

issueDTO.title: Support GCP Workload Identity in the repository-gcs plugin
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Storing snapshots with the repository-gcs plugin requires a gcp service account key that's stored as a kubernetes secret. We'd like to avoid this secret as it requires additional overhead like periodically rotating the secret for security. GCP's Workload Identity feature would be a better alternative that avoids the need for a secret. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Use GCP's workload identity feature for authentication in the repository-gcs plugin. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

issueDTO.title: Updating the Porchctl CLI
issueDTO.description:
When using Porchctl CLI commands e.g. `porchctl --help` the returned help messages are quite outdated in many ways.

One example is as follows doing `porchctl rpkg propose-delete --help` the example provided is utilizing the old "blueprint-hashcode" naming scheme which is no longer valid for the latest porch version.

Another is the introduction of new logic for example the "copy-merge" strategy for update first introduced here https://github.com/nephio-project/porch/pull/209.

@liamfallon has already updated our CLI guide in the documentation in this PR https://github.com/nephio-project/docs/pull/253.

These should be followed up on and integrated into the Porchctl CLI itself.

issueDTO.title: Ability to keep the most significant video frames in dataset
issueDTO.description:
A video can contain lots of frames, most of which do not bring any new information. A dataset created from a video can be significantly reduced without affecting model performance, if we keep only the most significant frames.

References: 
- BubbleNets: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1903.11779.pdf, https://github.com/griffbr/BubbleNets
- Frames can be checked for similarity (similarly to near duplicate removal)
comments: Hey @yunchu @vinnamkim, This issue seems unassigned, If it's still available I am interested to work on it.

Hi,

Basically, it's covered by [the NDR transform](https://openvinotoolkit.github.io/datumaro/stable/docs/reference/_autosummary/datumaro.plugins.ndr.html#module-datumaro.plugins.ndr) plugin added in ~v0.3. From our experience with this feature, it produces good results, but can also be extended: 
- to support just the core set frame list dumping
- to support computed state dumping and loading for mixing several input sources without the need to recompute everything (sometimes there is not enough RAM for all the sources simultaneously)

We had a script like this for one interesting use case with videos specifically (there are some comments in the code):

<details>

For Datumaro v0.3

```python
from pathlib import Path
from queue import Queue
import sys
from argparse import ArgumentParser
from typing import Any, Iterable, List, Optional, Sequence
import datumaro as dm
import datumaro.plugins.ndr as dm_ndr
import numpy as np
from concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor
from datumaro.util.image import load_image
from tqdm import tqdm


class NDR(dm_ndr.NDR):
    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)

        self._sample_keys = []
        self._embeddings = []
        self._deduplicated_item_ids = None

    def get_deduplicated_item_ids(self) -> Sequence[str]:
        "Returns the list of deduplicated items, before resolving under-/oversampling conditions"

        if not self._initialized:
            raise Exception("The index is not initialized yet.")

        return sorted(self._deduplicated_item_ids)

    def append_state(self, values: Iterable[Any]):
        for sample, embedding in values:
            self._sample_keys.append(sample)
            self._embeddings.append(embedding)

    def init_cache(self):
        return self._init_cache()

    def compute_state(self, item: dm.DatasetItem, img: np.ndarray | str):
        if isinstance(img, str):
            img = load_image(img)

        # Not handle empty image, as utils/image.py if check empty
        if len(img.shape) == 2:
            img = np.stack((img,) * 3, axis=-1)
        elif len(img.shape) == 3:
            if img.shape[2] == 1:
                img = np.stack((img[:, :, 0],) * 3, axis=-1)
            elif img.shape[2] == 4:
                img = img[..., :3]
            elif img.shape[2] == 3:
                pass
            else:
                raise ValueError(
                    "Item %s: invalid image shape: "
                    "unexpected number of channels (%s)" % (item.id, img.shape[2])
                )
        else:
            raise ValueError(
                "Item %s: invalid image shape: "
                "unexpected number of dimensions (%s)" % (item.id, len(img.shape))
            )

        if self.algorithm == dm_ndr.Algorithm.gradient:
            # Calculate gradient
            embedding = self._cgrad_feature(img)
        else:
            raise NotImplementedError()

        return item.id, embedding

    def _remove(self):
        sample_keys = self._sample_keys
        embeddings = self._embeddings

        if not sample_keys and not embeddings:
            if self.working_subset == dm.DEFAULT_SUBSET_NAME:
                # avoid video reading for getting length
                working_subset_length = float("inf")
                working_subset = dm.Dataset(self._extractor)
            else:
                working_subset_length = len(working_subset)
                working_subset = dm.Dataset(self._extractor.get_subset(self.working_subset))

            # 1 thread reads frames (only sequentially for a video)
            # 2 thread computes frame embeddings
            with ThreadPoolExecutor(2) as pool:
                queue = Queue()

                working_subset_iter = iter(tqdm(
                    ((item, item.media.data) for item in working_subset),
                    total=working_subset_length
                ))
                next_sample, next_sample_media = next(working_subset_iter, (None, None))
                while queue or next_sample:
                    if not queue.full() and next_sample is not None:
                        queue.put(pool.submit(self.compute_state, next_sample, next_sample_media))
                        next_sample, next_sample_media = next(working_subset_iter, (None, None))

                    processed_sample, embedding = queue.get()
                    sample_keys.append(processed_sample)
                    embeddings.append(embedding)

        if self.num_cut and self.num_cut > len(embeddings):
            raise ValueError("The number of images is smaller than the cut you want")

        if self.seed:
            np.random.seed(self.seed)

        if self.algorithm == dm_ndr.Algorithm.gradient:
            all_key, fidx, kept_index, key_counter, removed_index_with_sim = self._gradient_based(
                embeddings, **self.algorithm_specific
            )
        else:
            raise NotImplementedError()

        self._deduplicated_item_ids = set(sample_keys[ii] for ii in kept_index)

        kept_index = self._keep_cut(
            self.num_cut,
            all_key,
            fidx,
            kept_index,
            key_counter,
            removed_index_with_sim,
            self.over_sample,
            self.under_sample,
        )
        self.kept_item_id = set(sample_keys[ii] for ii in kept_index)


# A single dataset contains several somewhat similar video sequences from 3 synchronized cameras
# Each video is about 100-200k frames, Full HD
# Here wo do something similar to what could be done with datumaro projects, but more efficiently
source_specs_cam1 = [
    ("datasets/seq1_cam1.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq1_cam1_%06d"}),
    ("datasets/seq2_cam1.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq2_cam1_%06d"}),
    ("datasets/seq3_cam1.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq3_cam1_%06d"}),
]
source_specs_cam2 = [
    ("datasets/seq1_cam2.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq1_cam2_%06d"}),
    ("datasets/seq2_cam2.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq2_cam2_%06d"}),
    ("datasets/seq3_cam2.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq3_cam2_%06d"}),
]
source_specs_cam3 = [
    ("datasets/seq1_cam3.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq1_cam3_%06d"}),
    ("datasets/seq2_cam3.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq2_cam3_%06d"}),
    ("datasets/seq3_cam3.mp4", {"format": "video_frames", "name_pattern": "seq3_cam3_%06d"}),
]

def main(args: Optional[List[str]] = None) -> int:
    parser = ArgumentParser()
    # parser.add_argument("-f", "--format", required=False, help="Output dataset format (default: as input)")
    parser.add_argument("-k", "--count", type=int, required=False, help="The number of output frames")
    # parser.add_argument("--save-media", action="store_true", help="Save images")
    # parser.add_argument("input_dataset", help="Input dataset path (pathspec)")
    parser.add_argument("output_dir")

    parsed_args = parser.parse_args(args)
    subset_name = dm.DEFAULT_SUBSET_NAME

    base_output_dir = Path(parsed_args.output_dir)
    for source_name, source_specs in [
        ("cam1", source_specs_cam1),
        ("cam2", source_specs_cam2),
        ("cam3", source_specs_cam3),
    ]:
        output_dir = base_output_dir / f"{source_name}_uniq"

        sources = []
        common_ndr_state = []
        working_threads = 2 # depends on your system capabilities
        with ThreadPoolExecutor(working_threads) as pool: 
            def _load_source(source_params, source_id):
                path, params = source_params
                source = dm.Dataset.import_from(path, **params)

                source_ndr = NDR(source, num_cut=None, working_subset=subset_name)

                state_values = [
                    source_ndr.compute_state(sample, sample.media.data)
                    for sample in tqdm(source, total=float("inf"), position=source_id)
                ]

                return source, state_values

            for source, ndr_state in pool.map(_load_source, source_specs, range(len(source_specs))):
                sources.append(source)
                common_ndr_state.extend(ndr_state)

        dataset = dm.Dataset.from_extractors(*sources)

        ndr = NDR(dataset, num_cut=parsed_args.count, working_subset=subset_name)
        ndr.append_state(common_ndr_state)
        ndr.init_cache()

        output_dir.mkdir(parents=True)

        # save NDR result frame list 
        with (output_dir / "deduplicated.list").open('w') as f:
            for sample_id in ndr.get_deduplicated_item_ids():
                print(sample_id, file=f)

        # save NDR raw sample frame list ("the core set")
        with (output_dir / "ndr_sample.list").open('w') as f:
            for sample_id in ndr.kept_item_id:
                print(sample_id, file=f)

    return 0

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main(sys.argv[1:]))

```

</details>

So, I think, it would be great to extend API and CLI options for this feature, if you don't have other ideas for improvements already.

Do let me know if you got anything else that might help.

issueDTO.title: Add dataset quality checks
issueDTO.description:
When there is a dataset, it is often important to be able to check its quality. There are few way to check it: 
- compare annotations against a specification. Find too small boxes, too large boxes, too close points etc.
- compare annotations from several sources, match by distance
- annotate a dataset with a model, compare annotations against the inference results

It would be nice to support these and other approaches to quality checking.

Currently, in 0.1.6, the approaches 2 and 3 are implemented as `datum merge`.
comments: Added dataset validation for classification, detection and segmentation tasks in #160, #227, #233

issueDTO.title: Improve `sidemax` default behavior in `packing.py`
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the behavior you would like added to mBuild**

With PACKMOL 21, there were some bug fixes that impacted the speed and memory usage (https://github.com/mosdef-hub/mbuild/pull/1256). I noticed the memory usage and time performance are especially sensitive to the `sidemax` parameter. Right now we use a default of 100nm. There should be no reason to ever use a `sidemax` value larger than the volume you're packing.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

If `sidemax` isn't specified by the user, the default behavior should be to calculate it from the box used for the packing method.

Run

issueDTO.title: Include namespace in ui/metrics
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I am using the opencost ui and I do a breakdown based on this:
controller,service,pod
Unfortunately  the listing does not contain the namespace.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

For example instead of the current listing like:
deployment:traefik
I would rather like to see
deployment:traefik:trafik

because different teams could deploy the same app in their own namepsace like
deployment:team-a:traefik
deployment:team-b:traefik

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I have not found any option to include the namespace.

**Additional context**
Add any other context, documentation links, or screenshots about the feature request here.
comments:
It sounds like you're looking for multi-aggregation? It's supported in the API but not the UI (yet)
https://github.com/opencost/opencost-ui/issues/9
yes that works fine... one additional nice feature would be to habe a filter similar to the aggregation. Eg. only show pods in a given namespace...
Can I take this? @mattray
/assign

Just to provide some more details, what the OP requested can be achieved by using multi-aggregation like this: `agg=namespace,controller` As Matt had mentioned, this can't be done directly through the UI, you need to manually edit the URL. Here's an example in the demo environment: https://demo.infra.opencost.io/?agg=namespace,controller
@ameijer pls consider closing this and reopening the UI issue: https://github.com/opencost/opencost-ui/issues/9

Grok by xAI is an advanced AI chatbot developed by xAI, designed to answer questions, generate text, extract information from data, and create images.  
This integration allows AI agents and workflows to leverage multiple Grok APIs for content creation, extraction, summarization, visual generation, and more.

---

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

issueDTO.title: DOC:  min_itemsize for HDFStore append for encoded strings
issueDTO.description:
I'm confused about how to preset min_itemsizes for appending to an HDFStore. Say DataFrame a and b in the MWE below is user-provided, so it can contain any character and the encoding is unknown. Appending a works, but appending b fails even though:

```python
In [4]: len('???')
Out[4]: 1
```
So far I simply used str.len().max() on the string columns to the the numbers for min_itemsize, but this does not work in the example here. This MWE is of course simplified, but I guess I'm wondering:

- how does pytables come up with the string length?
- how should I determine the string length? Considering the encoding is unknown, but pytables assumes some encoding / pytables converts the strings to some other object?

In this toy example I could encode the string as utf-8 to get the correct length, but this isn't a general approach:

```python
In [5]: len('???'.encode('utf-8'))
Out[5]: 3
```

#### MWE:
```python
import pandas as pd
                                                      
a = pd.DataFrame([['a', 'b']], columns = ['A', 'B'])
b = pd.DataFrame([['???', 'b']], columns = ['A', 'B'])

store = pd.HDFStore('/tmp/tmpstore')

store.append('df', a, min_itemsizes={'A': 1, 'B': 1})
store.append('df', b, min_itemsizes={'A': 1, 'B': 1}) # fails

```

#### Expected Output
ValueError: Trying to store a string with len [3] in [values_block_0] column but
this column has a limit of [1]!
Consider using min_itemsize to preset the sizes on these columns
Closing remaining open files:/tmp/tmpstore...done

#### Output of ``pd.show_versions()``

<details>INSTALLED VERSIONS
------------------
commit: None
python: 3.5.2.final.0
python-bits: 64
OS: Linux
OS-release: 4.4.28-2-MANJARO
machine: x86_64
processor: 
byteorder: little
LC_ALL: en_US.UTF-8
LANG: en_DE.UTF-8
LOCALE: en_US.UTF-8

pandas: 0.19.0
nose: 1.3.7
pip: 8.1.2
setuptools: 27.2.0
Cython: 0.23.5
numpy: 1.11.2
scipy: 0.18.1
statsmodels: None
xarray: None
IPython: 5.1.0
sphinx: 1.4.8
patsy: None
dateutil: 2.5.3
pytz: 2016.7
blosc: None
bottleneck: None
tables: 3.3.0
numexpr: 2.6.1
matplotlib: 1.5.3
openpyxl: None
xlrd: None
xlwt: None
xlsxwriter: None
lxml: None
bs4: None
html5lib: None
httplib2: None
apiclient: None
sqlalchemy: 1.1.3
pymysql: None
psycopg2: 2.6.2 (dt dec pq3 ext lo64)
jinja2: 2.8
boto: None
pandas_datareader: None
</details>
comments:
`min_itemsize` is the kw (not `min_itemsizes`).

but the size is actually the length of the stored bytes (and not characters), so you 
need to encode anyhow. your best bet is to simply make a larger than needed size.

```
In [52]: store = pd.HDFStore('tmp.h5', mode='w')

In [53]: store.append('df', a, min_itemsize={'A': 10, 'B': 10}, encoding='utf-8')

In [54]: store.append('df', b)
```

docs are [here](http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/io.html#string-columns)

I suppose a note on using encodings correctly might be nice if you want to do a PR.
going to reopen this as a doc issue as explaining how the len counting works when data is encoded

So the assumption here is: The user knows if her string contains encoded characters? In that case calling `len(string)` wouldn't suffice, instead one would need to do `len(string.encode('encoding'))` as demonstrated above (or the equivalent on a DataFrame column). In addition the encoding kw needs to be specified when appending.
I'd like to submit a PR to clarify this. Will try to do this in the next few days.

I'm trying to store dataframes in a store.
In the first dataframe, I have a 'chrNumber' column of 1 in that column.
In the further dataframes, I have a 'chrNumber' column of 10,11,12,... and so on  in that column.
Although I have set min_itemsize={'chrNumber':2} in  the store.append() command 
But, I still get the  ValueError:

------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError: Trying to store a string with len [2] in [chrNumber] column but
this column has a limit of [1]!
Consider using min_itemsize to preset the sizes on these columns
Closing remaining open files:df_all.h5...done
------------------------------------------------------------------

And this is the python code for appending dataframes into a store with min_itemsize.

store.append('df', augmented_chrBased_snp_df, data_columns=['Cancer Type', 'Sample', 'paperDOI', 'genomeAssembly', 'type', 'chrNumber', 'start', 'end', 'originalNucleotide', 'mutatedNucleotide', 'dataSource','strand', 'PyramidineStrand', 'Mutation Type', 'Mutation Subtype'], min_itemsize={'Cancer Type':15, 'Sample':8, 'chrNumber':2})

@burcakotlu, it might be due to the HDFStore already existing, therefore the min size for that column is set. I fixed this error in my case by deleting the existing HDFStore and recreating it, ensuring the the min_itemsize parameter was set from the beginning. Hope this helps!
Does this issue still need to be resolved? I am looking for a first-time open-source contribution.

@riteshpen Yes please! The documentation for HDFStore is really bad IMHO

Consider the following
* https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.HDFStore.put.html
* https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.HDFStore.append.html

It is not explained what min_itemsize actually does. It is stated that it is a dictionary, but clearly in other places min_itemsize is used as an integer. What are the actual allowed types of min_itemsize, and what is the expected behaviour?
take

issueDTO.title: [BUG] `/magic-item/[id]` page crashes when `rarity` is null
issueDTO.description:
## Description

When visiting the `/magic-item/[id]` page for an item that has a `null` value for its `rarity` property, the following error is thrown.

`Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: can't access property "name", $setup.item.rarity is null`

Which implies that Nuxt is trying to index into the `rarity` property to get its name, only to hit a key error because `rarity` is null. The magic item that alerted me to this bug was the 2024 SRD Belt of Giant Strength (`srd-2024_belt-of-giant-strength`). Examining the API payload in the network tab when visiting `/monsters/srd-2024_belt-of-giant-strength` I was able to confirm that the `rarity` field was null.

The fix for this is as simple as a null-check, optional chaining, or nullish coalseasing.

## To Reproduce

This bug was observed on the `staging` branch of the website running on a local Nuxt development server, pulling data from a fork of the `staging` branch of the API, running on a local Django developement server.

1. Visit a the single-view page for a magic item where the rarity is null (ie. 2024 SRD Belt of Giant Strength).

2. Note that the page doesn???t load. Viewing the JS console you see the error message described above.

repository.description: An SRD and open-source material reference site for 5th edition D&D
repository.name: open5e

summary.otherNotes: The bug was observed on the staging branch of the website running on a local Nuxt development server, pulling data from a fork of the staging branch of the API, running on a local Django development server.

issueDTO.title: Download Progress Exceeds Total Size
issueDTO.description:
while downloading `Qwen2.5 7B Instruct 4bit MLX` the download progress incorrectly showed `6.18 GB / 4 GB`, meaning the downloaded size exceeded the total size. Investigating whether this is a frontend display issue or a backend reporting error.


![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1ff3c9cc-83ee-4358-ac0f-b6ee68860157)
comments: If it's a model in our gallery it probably means the download size in the gallery is wrong.  If it's a model you entered yourself then it might be a problem with the function that calculates model size...most likely because of which files it includes in its calculation?

OR...the model size is correct and the calculation of how much has been downloaded could be wrong.  The way we calculate how much has been downloaded could use improvement!  (I suspect that might be teh case here...based on the model name I would expect it to be about 4GB.

> If it's a model in our gallery it probably means the download size in the gallery is wrong. If it's a model you entered yourself then it might be a problem with the function that calculates model size...most likely because of which files it includes in its calculation?

it was a model in our gallery `Qwen2.5 7B Instruct 4bit MLX`
@dadmobile @mina-parham  Is this assigned to somebody ?
No, not right now. The problem is with the way we calculate how much has been downloaded. If you are interested in taking this on please let us know and I can give more details.
@dadmobile Yeah , I am on to take this issue. Please do share me the necessary pre-reads

Great! The actual code that downloads the models is in the transformerlab-api repo in a file under `transformerlab/shared/ download_huggingface_model.py`. The issue with the code is the way it tracks download progress.  I believe it naively records the free space on your drive and the start and compares to that as it goes.  You can imagine how this will not be accurate if there are any other changes happening on your hard drive.  

Possible approaches that come to mind:
- you could use the hugging face API to specifically track disk space in the directory of the downloaded model
- you could try using the progress indicators from the output of the huggingface call itself to show a more accurate progress bar
-
Another helpful thing to do would be to set the progress to 100 if a download finishes successfully so we don't get weird numbers like:

summary.otherNotes: The issue is with the way the download progress is tracked, it's not accurate and can be affected by other changes on the hard drive. Possible approaches to fix this include using the hugging face API to track disk space, using the progress indicators from the hugging face call, or setting the progress to 100 if the download finishes successfully.

issueDTO.title: feature: Remove the need of specifying `kubeflex-operator.install=false`
issueDTO.description:
### Feature Description

Currently, when adding WDSes with a second chart or when isntalling the core-chart in a cluster with an existing deployment of KubeFlex, the user has to explicitly set the value `kubeflex-operator.install=false` , which may lead to errors and extra work.

### Proposed Solution

This is an untested proposed solution:

1. add variable definition in `_helpers..tpl` that detect the existence of kubeflex deployment using `lookup` function

something like

```yaml
{{- define "kflex_not_installed" }}
{{- if lookup <kubeflex deployment> }}
false
{{- else }}
true
{{- end }}
{{- end }}
```

2. change the `values.yaml` file to set the default value like this

```yaml
kubeflex-operator:
  install: {{ include "kflex_not_installed" .}}
```

### Want to contribute?

- [ ] I would like to work on this issue.

### Additional Context

This would be backwards compatible and would allow to override the default value from the CLI
comments: cc @MikeSpreitzer
This adds a footgun like the one noted in https://github.com/kubestellar/kubestellar/pull/2935#discussion_r2210253424 , right?

> This adds a footgun like the one noted in [#2935 (comment)](https://github.com/kubestellar/kubestellar/pull/2935#discussion_r2210253424) , right?

I don't think #2935 has an issue nor should this... assuming that it works as proposed.
We would not burden the user to state explicitly if kflex is aready in cluster. The chart would look for it and take appropriate action.
@Rupam-It Can I look into this issue ?

> [@Rupam-It](https://github.com/Rupam-It) Can I look into this issue ?

Hii @RohanMishra315  thanks for your interest. But before start or assign I will request you come up with a good proposal for it !
Then start the actuall implementation..

Hello @Rupam-It  @francostellari ! I would like to express my interest in working on this improvement for the KubeStellar Helm chart. Below is my proposal for enhancing the installation experience:

### Background

Currently, users must manually set `kubeflex-operator.install=false` when an existing `kubeflex` deployment is present in the cluster. This extra step can be error-prone and may lead to duplicate operator installations.

### Objective

Automate the detection of any existing `kubeflex` deployment and adjust the installation behavior accordingly. This reduces manual configuration, avoids unnecessary errors, and provides a more seamless experience.

### Proposed Solution

- **Helm Logic Enhancement:**  
  Implement a helper in `helpers.tpl` that uses the Helm `lookup` function to check for an existing `kubeflex` deployment in all namespaces.
    - If present, set `kubeflex-operator.install` to `false` by default.
    - If absent, allow it to install as usual.

- **Dynamic Value Handling:**  
  Use this auto-detection logic as the new default, while still allowing users to override the value directly.

- **Documentation:**  
  Update the README and chart documentation to clarify this behavior (auto-detection, manual override, limitations).

- **Testing:**  
  Add or update test cases to ensure:
    - No existing deployment ??? operator is installed.
    - Existing deployment ??? operator is not installed.
    - User override is always respected.

- **Limitations:**  
  Document:
    - Helm 3+ requirement.
    - RBAC permissions necessary for the `lookup` function to work.
    - Need for cluster reachability at install/upgrade time.

### Request

If no one is currently assigned, I would be happy to take ownership of this enhancement. Please let me know if there are any specific considerations, or if you have feedback or preferences regarding the solution or implementation strategy.

Thank you for considering my proposal???I look forward to contributing!
thanks @Akshitha2106 , submit an PR!
@Akshitha2106 you can work on this issue, I'll take the other one, but if you need any help, feel free to reach out to me !
@Akshitha2106 are you still working on this issue?
If not, I can take it up.

> If not, I can take it up.

Ok!

@Rupam-It @francostellari 
We can't use dynamic template rendering in `values.yaml` file for settting up `kubeflex-operator.install` value. Also, we can't use named templates in `Charts.yaml`  for controlling the dependency condition dynamically because this file is evaluated earlier before the templates are renderred.

Pre-create Hooks aren't also useful for controlling kubeflex-operator deployment because at that time HELM will already know what to deploy in the cluster. 

So, I have an idea of changing the `kubflex-operator` HELM chart by introducing a new Boolean variable called `autoDetect`. Initially, we will set this variable to `false`. We will define a named template `kubeflex-operator.shouldInstall` . If `autoDetect` is set to `false` [ This is the default value for kubeflex-operator ] then the `kubeflex-operator.shouldInstall` will return `true` and if  `autoDetect` is set to `true`  [ This value will be passed by the `Kubestellar-core` Helm chart ], then we will perform `lookup` and the named template will return true/false based on the availability of `kubeflex-operator` components in the cluster.

We will wrap all the resource templates with if condition using `kubeflex-operator.shouldInstall` named template. This will not affect any previous behaviour of Kubeflex because:

- For standalone kubeflex-operator installation: The default `autoDetect: false` ensures the chart behaves exactly as it does now, with no surprises.
- And, For kubestellar Helm chart installation: The parent chart simply overrides the `autoDetect` to `true`, activating the kubeflex-operator autoDetection logic.

And, I think this approach will help to achieve the automation we wanted in the kubestellar core HELM chart without breaking the default behavior of kubeflex chart.

What are your thoughts regarding this ? If OK, I can start implementing. Thanks

@greninja517 I don't like the idea of modifying the KubeFlex chart as you suggested.
This is not an issue that relates to the KubeFlex chart.
It's only a problem for KubeStellar core-charts that want to use an existing KubeFlex.

1. can we investigate with the Helm community if there is a know solution to the problem of deciding to install/or-not a dependent chart at the moment the template is rendered based on cluster resources?
2. an alternative solution, which however adds other complications, would be to move the kflex install from a dependent chart into a helm-job container that is controller by the `lookup` function
I have tried to seek help form Helm user channel: https://kubernetes.slack.com/archives/C0NH30761/p1753451642902949

I don't think using a Job to install the dependent `kubeflex` chart is ideal. This way `KubeStellar` release will be unaware about `kubeflex`. 
Let's see if we can find any solution from the community.

issueDTO.title: Feature request: Archive group
issueDTO.description: A nice feature would be to be able to archive groups
comments:
Looks like I almost would have created a duplicate.
But it may have some additional ideas:

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
If you have many groups for specific activities you may want to archive groups if the holiday is over, but not delete them if maybe someone later remembers he forgot to add an expense or wanted to look again were they all have been and spend their money.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Allow us to archive groups.
Most people would probably archive groups only if the balance is settled up, but I wouldn't make that an hard requirement.
It should also probably be archived on a per user bases and not for all of them if one decided to archive his group.
Where I would add a hard requirement, is for auto archiving a group if it hasn't been used in 3 - 12 months and is already settled up.

repository.name: split-pro

summary.main: Implement a feature to archive groups for specific activities, allowing users to keep a record of their past activities without deleting them.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Archive groups on a per-user basis, with optional auto-archiving feature if the group hasn't been used in 3-12 months and is already settled up.
summary.otherNotes: The feature request is related to a problem where users may want to archive groups for specific activities, but not delete them, in case they need to access them later. The solution proposed is to allow users to archive groups on a per-user basis, with an optional auto-archiving feature if the group hasn't been used in 3-12 months and is already settled up.

Hello ! In french official typographic code, we need a space before **and** after the " : " caracter. I mean, it wouldn't be so clear to include at the beginning of the README just the language codes, and so on.
I think that keeping both the codes and the flags is the best option for my use case.
However thanks for having pointed out!

Would be nice to have translation hosted on something like Weblate or Crowding, because maintaining a translation on GitHub is problematic in the long run and simply inconvenient.

> Would be nice to have translation hosted on something like Weblate or Crowding

What would the benefits be?

I didn't work with Weblate, but for Crowdin:
- Automatic removal of changed strings, so translators can know which strings changed and has to be translated 
- A really convenient UI and workflow, all strings are in one place and you just go through them for your language one by one. Strings can also optionally contain context.
- If I want to fix one translation issue, I don't have to fork the whole repo and submit a pull request, I can just go on Crowdin/Weblate and change that string
- Dictionary (You have to open it for everyone or have a proofreader). People can add some words to project dictionary, so all translations of one term can be easily matched 

And some more. TLDR: it's just much nicer to work with for a translator, and as a developer you can track the progress of each language.

But that's for Crowdin, I haven't worked much with Weblate. I know that Weblate is open source, while Crowdin is not and mainly commercial, but offers a generous free plan for open source projects. If I had to choose, I would choose Crowdin because UI and workflow is much nicer.

From the "downsides", translations have to be in separate files with some supported format. From what I know .po files are ideal for translations, but Crowdin also supports a bunch of other formats.

(I swear I'm not paid by Crowdin marketing team)
I will personnally work on the spanish translation, as I've already done for v1.3.

issueDTO.title: Reduce the size of `FnArg::Regular` variant (macro-backends)
issueDTO.description: The `RegularArg` struct used in `FnArg::Regular` variant of the macro-backends crate is quite large, triggering the the `clippy::large_enum_variant` lint. It might be nice to reduce it by using some references.
comments: Hi all! I'd like to contribute by taking up this refactor if it's available. Are we okay with `Box`-ing the fields in `RegularArg` to reduce its size, or would you prefer sticking to references for optimization? Let me know your thoughts, thanks!
Boxing it is only worth it if it only rarely happens to be the big variant (like say if you have a big error type). RegularArg is pretty common, so it's likely not worth it.

At the suggestion of @mejrs on Discord, I'm planning to try to fix this during a live coding session with some people working on learning Rust at the Recurse Center.

Here's the output from `cargo +nightly rustc -- -Zprint-type-sizes` in the macros-backend crate for the `RegularArg` struct:

```
print-type-size type: `method::RegularArg<'_>`: 272 bytes, alignment: 8 bytes
print-type-size     field `.from_py_with`: 96 bytes
print-type-size     field `.default_value`: 136 bytes
print-type-size     field `.name`: 24 bytes
print-type-size     field `.ty`: 8 bytes
print-type-size     field `.option_wrapped_type`: 8 bytes
```

So probably making `from_py_with` and `default_value` references will fix this.
I tried but didn't get terribly far. I got stuck trying to make `PyFunctionArgPyO3Attributes` wrap references. That may not be necessary though.

summary.main: Reduce the size of `FnArg::Regular` variant by using some references.
summary.validationOrRequirement: To fix this, the `#[allow]` attribute needs to be removed to get clippy to report it. Also, consider boxing the large fields to reduce the total size of the enum.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author tried to fix this by boxing the fields in `RegularArg` but got stuck trying to make `PyFunctionArgPyO3Attributes` wrap references.
summary.otherNotes: The `RegularArg` struct used in `FnArg::Regular` variant of the macro-backends crate is quite large, triggering the `clippy::large_enum_variant` lint. The main goal is to reduce its size by using some references.

issueDTO.title: I get an error when working with deepseek
issueDTO.description:
Hello. I tested different providers. I figured out all of them except deepseek. The thing is that it displays a strange error

```
 DeepSeek: unknown finish reason 
```

Code:
```
      $response = Prism::text()
            ->using(Provider::DeepSeek, 'deepseek-chat')
            ->withPrompt($this->prompt)
            ->asText();
```
In blade:

```
  {{ $response->text }}
```
comments:
According to https://api-docs.deepseek.com/api/create-chat-completion
`finish_reason` can be
```
Possible values: [stop, length, content_filter, tool_calls, insufficient_system_resource]
```

Only `stop` and `tool_calls` is managed so you are probably getting another one.
https://github.com/prism-php/prism/blob/a1a0cc8d4918a60dd5d831138cd4c4eda46424d6/src/Providers/DeepSeek/Handlers/Text.php#L57
 
You can try to log the response before being processed by `Prism` and see what's the problem.
I'd be willing to accept a PR with additional stop support, I just don't have the bandwidth for it at the moment

summary.otherNotes: According to https://api-docs.deepseek.com/api/create-chat-completion, finish_reason can have possible values: [stop, length, content_filter, tool_calls, insufficient_system_resource]. Only stop and tool_calls is managed.
