issueDTO.title: Using keyword arguments to create Rects does not work.
issueDTO.description:
I was hesitant to come here, as this is my first time opening an issue on a GitHub project, but I think reporting this (even though you're already aware of it) could improve the experience for a PyGame noob when the bug is fixed (if it actually is one).

I'm talking about using keyword arguments to create Rects using `pygame.Rect`.

```
button: pygame.Rect = pygame.Rect((100, 100, 200, 50))
```
^ The above code works perfectly

```
button: pygame.Rect = pygame.Rect(single_arg=(100, 100, 200, 50))
```
^ This doesn't work, when I try to draw the Rect using `pygame.draw.rect`, nothing is drawn on the screen. It's weird, I don't think it's supposed to work like that. The same behavior is observed when using `(left=*, top=*, width=* height=*)` or `(left_top=*, width_height=*)`.

Update (as of this writing): The Rect is clearly created when I use print to check, but all of its information is reset. `print(button)` returns `Rect(0, 0, 0, 0)`.

I have no idea if other pygame functions have the same behavior. I apologize if I'm accidentally duplicating an existing issue. I can provide more information about the executed code if needed. I hope this helps!

`pygame.print_debug_info()` below:

```
Platform:               Windows-10-10.0.19045-SP0
System:                 Windows
System Version:         10.0.19045
Processor:              Intel64 Family 6 Model 158 Stepping 10, GenuineIntel        SSE2: Yes       AVX2: Yes   NEON: No
Architecture:           Bits: 64bit     Linkage: WindowsPE

Python:                 CPython 3.13.4 (tags/v3.13.4:8a526ec, Jun  3 2025, 17:46:04) [MSC v.1943 64 bit (AMD64)]
GIL Enabled:            True
pygame version:         2.5.5
SDL versions:           Linked: 2.32.6  Compiled: 2.32.6
SDL Mixer versions:     Linked: 2.8.1   Compiled: 2.8.1
SDL Font versions:      Linked: 2.24.0  Compiled: 2.24.0
SDL Image versions:     Linked: 2.8.8   Compiled: 2.8.8
Freetype versions:      Linked: 2.11.1  Compiled: 2.11.1

Display Driver:         windows
Mixer Driver:           wasapi
```
comments:
It's positional-only, that's why.

The stub for it could be improved to indicate this fact. Kwarg parsing is very slow, and rect creation needs to be as fast as possible.
Thanks for the report!
Aaah, so that's it. Thank you very much for the clarification! :D. In that case, I'll just close the issue. I think it's fine this way.
Reopening because of the aforementioned stub issue
Cool, sry about that.
Apart from stubs, it's also an issue that `pygame.Rect(single_arg=(100, 100, 200, 50))` doesn't raise an exception.

As a side note, a lot of `__init__` methods in the stubs are missing the positional-only marker.
Seems like stubtest misses it.

Also, maybe the rect docs can be improved with an example of how to create a new rect with kwargs (similar to `Surface.get_rect()` functionality).

The `print` statement is used to check the creation of the Rect, but it returns `(0, 0, 0, 0)` indicating that the information is reset.

issueDTO.title: Official and maintained Grammar definition file
issueDTO.description:
Every code editor I tried so far has incomplete or incorrect implementation of Pug syntax. Thus development with Pug lacks proper tooling, often breaks without a reason and is inefficient.

One way to solve this would be maintaining official grammar under pugjs organization. Like what for ex.
 [TypeScript has](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage). It will allow to join time of contributors together and maintain the single codebase.

The widely used format is the TextMate Language grammar [.tmLanguage](https://manual.macromates.com/en/language_grammars) (which doesn't support context though). All these editors accepts it:
- [Sublime Text](http://www.sublimetext.com/docs/3/syntax.html) +  [grammar](https://github.com/davidrios/pug-tmbundle)
- [Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/converting-from-textmate/#converting-a-textmate-grammar-bundle) + [grammar](https://github.com/genoma/language-pug)
- [VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/themes-snippets-colorizers)
- [PhpStorm](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/phpstorm/importing-textmate-bundles.html)

The next step would be to pick the best implementation, fix its issues and start from there.

Ideas, opinions?

??????
comments:
I notice problems in vim.

E.g. `each x in xs` the `in` is never keyword-ised.

And in `label(for=id)` the `for` _is_ keyword-ised.

There are many annoyances like this.

Having a standardised syntax file which is maintained by the language developers is always a fantastic idea. IMHO, however, it may be impractical, as there really is no 'standard' syntax definition file which is widely accepted. Although *'.tmLanguage'* files can be read by several code editors - and its specifications implemented to a certain degree - there are usually caveats and restrictions. Most of these software packages have their own, native syntax file formats, which is really what needs to be used when we want to take full advantage of all the features our chosen editor has to offer.

For instance: with version 3 of Sublime Text, we now have *['.sublime-syntax'](http://www.sublimetext.com/docs/3/syntax.html)* files, which are much easier to implement, specially for languages where we may have multiple embedded contexts, like Pug. Indeed, the current developer of the Sublime Text ".tmLanguage" file for Pug [seems to have abandoned the project](https://github.com/davidrios/pug-tmbundle/issues/10), as ".tmLanguage" files are not easy to edit and maintain, and require a form of compilation/transpilation for use with the new Sublime.

Also, for most code editors, users can download 'language packs', which include not only a syntax definition, but also other language specific goodies, such as snippets and code-completion enablers. These often require multiple files, developed and packaged alongside the syntax definition. 

This probably explains why, in the majority of cases, language support for different code editors ends up being either the work of the **code editor developer** - if it's a popular and often-requested language - or by some well-meaning volunteers, which often work in consultation with the language spec developers.

Currently, the 3 most popular code editors around seem to be Sublime Text, VS Code, and Atom. So, perhaps what we need is 3 code editor "Pros", who are already savvy with developing syntax files and language packages for their favourite editor, and who can setup 3 (semi-)official repositories for Pug language support for their editors - with support from the Pug team, which could make themselves available if any consultation is required.

If someone wants to contribute and maintain an "official" language file for pug, I'd be happy to have it live in a folder in this repository, but it's not something I personally have time to create/maintain.  Please feel free to submit a pull request though.
and also Adobe Brackets, an alternative cool and handy editor.
hey can i work on this?

> hey can i work on this?

Anyone who will reactive this proj/repo is a hero.

issueDTO.title: [Filters] Add filtering support to Search - Dags
issueDTO.description: ### View Search - Dags ### Filters to Add - Filter DAGs with **Import Errors** ??? `has_import_errors = true` - Filter DAGs by **Owner** ??? `owners = ['alice', 'bob', 'airflow']` - Filter **Stale DAGs** ??? `is_stale = true` - Filter DAGs by **Timetable** ??? (e.g. `CronTriggerTimetable`, `AssetOrTimeSchedule`) - Filter DAGs by **Bundle Name** or **Version** ??? `bundle_name = 'analytics'`, `bundle_version = 'v1.2.3'` - Filter DAGs with **Asset-Based Schedules** ??? Requires awareness of upstream asset dependencies - Filter **Unscheduled DAGs** ??? `schedule_interval = None` or equivalent ### API Support ?????? Partial - `/dags` returns many required fields (`has_import_errors`, `is_stale`, `bundle_name`, `owners`) - But does **not** currently support these as filter query parameters - Would require extending the DAG API to support additional filters ### UI Impact - Filters would appear at the top of the Search ??? DAGs screen - Should be consistent with filters for status, tags, and active/paused state already present - Multi-select or autocomplete where applicable (e.g., owners)
comments: I would love to work on this issue.
Thank you for assigning this to me. I will start working on it now.

Hi! I had a question and would appreciate your input on this. You mentioned wanting a UI filter to show only DAGs with import errors (`has_import_errors = true`). That makes sense, and I actually opened [this issue](https://github.com/apache/airflow/issues/53536) to implement the change on the API side as well. However, after digging into it, I realized there???s a complication: even though the `Dags` table has a `has_import_errors` field (which is `false` when there are no errors), if a DAG *does* have an import error, it never gets an entry in the `Dags` table at all. I tested this by creating a DAG with an import error: ```python from airflow import DAG from datetime import datetime # This will break the import! this_will_throw_an_error default_args = { 'start_date': datetime(2023, 1, 1), } dag = DAG( 'broken_dag', default_args=default_args, schedule_interval=None, ) ``` As expected, the database only has my older (valid) DAG, but not the new one with the import error. The broken DAG does show up in the Airflow UI (in the "Import Errors" section), but there???s no entry for it in the Dags table in the DB. This seems to be because there???s a separate `import_error` table handling these cases. I???ve also confirmed this with @rawwar . Given this setup, it seems like adding an API/UI filter on `has_import_errors` wouldn???t actually be useful, since the broken DAGs aren???t in the `Dags` table to be filtered in the first place, they???re already shown separately in the UI. Could you please advise whether we should still go ahead with this filter, or if it makes more sense to close the issue I opened yesterday as "not planned"? I can start looking into other filters in the meantime. Would appreciate a quick response, thanks!

Yes maybe just disregard that field for now and focus on other filters.

It???s weird I wasn???t able to identify where that Dag attribute was set. I???ll need to do more digging.

Thanks @AryanK1511 - sorry for the delay. Agree that that's weird. If you come across more that don't work or can't get to any, just comment on the issue and move on. All and any progress is helpful, happy to create other issues if we need to for tracking purposes.

Thanks again for taking this on!
Thank you so much for your help guys. I will start working on the other stuff now.

I???ve created the following issues for the API changes. Once I???ve completed them, I???ll add the UI filters all at once.

- #53738
- #53739
- #53740
- #53741

Could someone please assign these issues to me?
Assigned!

issueDTO.title: `Expr.rolling_*_by` exist but these method are not on `Series`
issueDTO.description:
### Checks

- [x] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported.
- [x] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest version](https://pypi.org/project/polars/) of Polars.

### Reproducible example

```python
import polars as pl
from datetime import datetime
date = pl.datetime_range(
    datetime(2001, 1, 1),
    datetime(2001, 1, 2),
   "1h",
   eager=True
)

 # This works fine
pl.select(pl.lit(pl.Series("index", range(25))).rolling_mean_by(s, "2h"))

# This doesn't exist
pl.Series("index", range(25)).rolling_mean_by(s, "2h")
```


### Log output

```shell
AttributeError: 'Series' object has no attribute 'rolling_mean_by'
```

### Issue description

The rule is usually that functions are both implemented on `Expr` and `Series`. That was not done here.

### Expected behavior

Series has these methods as well.

### Installed versions

<details>

```
Replace this line with the output of pl.show_versions(). Leave the backticks in place.
```

</details>

issueDTO.title: Refcounting changes after PEP 683
issueDTO.description:
PEP 683's "immortal objects" changed the meaning of reference counts; immortal objects have a fixed refcount value which never changes.

Further, the PEP [states](https://peps.python.org/pep-0683/#documentation): 

> Py_REFCNT() - add ???The refcounts 0 and 1 have specific meanings and all others only mean code somewhere is using the object, regardless of the value. 0 means the object is not used and will be cleaned up. 1 means code holds exactly a single reference.???

Does this mean that `PyAny::get_refcnt` should change, given that the upstream position is essentially that only 0 and 1 have meaning?
comments: What's the use case for `PyAny::get_refcnt`? Perhaps it should be deprecated in favor of methods with narrower semantics.

I might even suggest it doesn't need a replacement added immediately, we can let users call `pyo3::ffi::Py_REFCNT(obj.as_ptr())` to get the same functionality for now and if someone comes up with a desirable proposal for a safe API we could add that then?
Labelling as "Good First Issue" as all that's really needed is to remove or deprecate `.get_refcnt()` methods.

repository.description: Rust bindings for the Python interpreter
repository.name: pyo3

summary.main: Determine if `PyAny::get_refcnt` should change according to the new meaning of reference counts
summary.validationOrRequirement: PEP 683's changes and the meaning of reference counts, specifically 0 and 1 having specific meanings
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue description or comments
summary.otherNotes: The PEP 683 changed the meaning of reference counts; immortal objects have a fixed refcount value which never changes. Py_REFCNT() function now states that 0 and 1 have specific meanings, and all others only mean code somewhere is using the object, regardless of the value.

issueDTO.title: Add `User-Agent` header to all API requests
issueDTO.description:
**Description**:

Cartography currently makes HTTP requests without setting a `User-Agent` header. For better observability and integration with vendor APIs, all outbound requests from intel modules should include a standardized `User-Agent`.

**Proposed format**:

```
User-Agent: Cartography/0.x.y
```

Where `0.x.y` corresponds to the current version from `cartography.__version__`. If unavailable (e.g., in development), default to `Cartography/dev`.

**Benefits**:

* Easier debugging and tracing of requests in API logs
* Improves compatibility with vendors that expect or validate user-agents
* Aligns with standard HTTP client practices

**Suggested implementation**:

* Introduce a small utility (e.g., `build_session()`) in `cartography.util` to initialize a `requests.Session` with the appropriate `User-Agent`
* Refactor existing intel modules to use this session instead of directly instantiating `requests.Session()`

issueDTO.title: [??40] Add LLM traces into log output
issueDTO.description:
We'd like to introduce a lower level of log output (trace level, level below debug). For this level, we'd like to log whenever we call an LLM and the associated model being called plus what the LLM call is doing at a high level (e.g summarisation, introspection etc).

Definition of done:
- Users can enable a new logging level "TRACE", which includes all DEBUG log content, plus TRACE content. It should be possible to enable this config setting using the same abstractions as described [here](https://docs.portialabs.ai/manage-config#manage-logging).
- Whenever an LLM call is made, if the logging level is set to TRACE, it should output all LLM calls being made across all agents. The browser tool does not need to be updated, but the LLM tool must be.
- Docs are updated to indicate that the "TRACE" level of logging exists.

issueDTO.title: [Feature] - Use case-insensitive header matching for context-propagation data extraction
issueDTO.description:
Currently, the agent uses a case-sensitive header matchting of the tracing header used for context propagation (receiving data). This leads to the problem that the agent will not correlate/use tracing information in case the header names are in lower case.

#### Example

Data will successfully read from the following header: `X-B3-TraceId`

issueDTO.title: vmagent: print limited number of parse errors per target
issueDTO.description: ### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe Recently we misconfigured scraping and pointed a job to the wrong endpoint, which returns huge HTML. VMagent parses it line by line and prints an error on each line: ``` {"timestamp":"2025-04-30T08:56:42.792Z","level":"error","caller":victoriametrics/lib/protoparser/prometheus/parser.go:231","message":"error when scraping \"http://<>/metrics/prometheus/\" from job \"yt_planck_spyt\" with labels {operation_id=\"92c77845-b08cc7ad-134403e8-34aa74ef\": cannot unmarshal Prometheus line \"/logPage/?driverId=driver-20250430052250-4283&logType=stderr\\\">stderr\": cannot parse value \"href=\\\"http://<>/logPage/?driverId=driver-20250430052250-4283&logType=stderr\\\">stderr\": unparsed tail left after parsing float64 from \"href=\\\"<>:27006/logPage/?driverId=driver-20250430052250-4283&logType=stderr\\\">stderr\": \"href=\\\"<>:27006/logPage/?driverId=driver-20250430052250-4283&logType=stderr\\\">stderr\"; scrape errors can be disabled by -promscrape.suppressScrapeErrors command-line flag"} ``` ### Describe the solution you'd like It could be beneficial to have an upper limit???e.g., 10 errors per scrape response. ### Describe alternatives you've considered `promscrape.suppressScrapeErrors` removes logs completely ??? that's not what we want ### Additional information _No response_
comments:
Hi @tIGO , I meet the same issue and I solved it with set Format, the code is 
```go
// prometheus sdk version is github.com/prometheus/client_golang@v1.18.0
pushAddr := ...
pusher := push.New(pushAddr, "test-job").
	Collector(prometheus.NewGauge(prometheus.GaugeOpts{
		Name: "test_metric_",
		Help: "Test metric",
	})).Format(expfmt.FmtText)
```

The reason is that the prometheus push uses `FmtProtoDelim` by default.

cc @hagen1778 @makasim
If you use prometheus sdk >= `github.com/prometheus/client_golang@v1.20.5`, you may set format with `expfmt.NewFormat(expfmt.TypeTextPlain)`
I think [throttler logger](https://github.com/VictoriaMetrics/VictoriaMetrics/blob/master/lib/logger/throttler.go) could be of help here

repository.description: VictoriaMetrics: fast, cost-effective monitoring solution and time series database
repository.name: VictoriaMetrics

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to print a limited number of parse errors per target when scraping huge HTML responses.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a way to limit the number of parse errors per target, and the solution should not remove logs completely.
summary.attemptedFixes: The comment section provides a solution by setting the Format to expfmt.FmtText, which is not the default format used by prometheus push. Additionally, the throttler logger is suggested as a potential solution.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to misconfigured scraping and huge HTML response, and the goal is to print a limited number of parse errors per target. The solution proposed is to set an upper limit, e.g., 10 errors per scrape response. The comment section discusses the issue in more detail, including the use of `promscrape.suppressScrapeErrors` and the importance of considering the server-side scenario.

issueDTO.title: WSL Should Considered As Operating System
issueDTO.description: First of all thanks for this project I love it! I am using WSL2 for my main development. Wakatime considers it as another operating system but in Wakapi UI it is considered as Linux. I think this mentality should change. I came to this conclusion from your this comment. https://github.com/muety/wakapi/issues/718#issuecomment-2557603423 Also in last softwere industry surveys also listing WSL as another operation system. So I know technically it is not but here is the situation 😄 ### Wakatime - Same Data ### Wakapi - Same Data
comments:
> Also in last softwere industry surveys also listing WSL as another operation system

Could you share them? I'd be interested.

WSL2 is essentially a virtualization technology, compare it with Docker. You're running _Linux_ inside _Windows_, so the only reasonable options to display here, in my opinion, is either of those (instead of "WSL" / "Docker", ...).

But since you're not the first person bringing this up and since it's a small and not very much impactful change, I'll add it as change request nevertheless.

Sure, here is some surveys [Stackoverflow 2024](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2024/technology#1-operating-system) [Stackoverflow 2023](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2023/#section-most-popular-technologies-operating-system) I also regenerated my summaries today (before your message) and older Linux data became WSL. but new datas are considered as Linux again. I tried regenerate again but there is no change. Also a lot of "unknown" labeled data instead of "coding" but clearly they are came from VsCode extension and has coding related info such as branch or etc whilte category field is empty. But it is not related with WSL.

Hm maybe WSL showed in above picture because I clicked import data in integration tab for wakatime. I will check again after my 24 hour waiting time complete

Edit: Yes above WSL data comes from Wakatime Integration. When I click import data and regenerate data form danger zone, it syncs like that.

So there is no Wakapi support for WSL but it reads Wakatime WSL data as WSL as well instead of changing to Linux.

issueDTO.title: Set `pause_on_next_bootstrap` on an offline cluster
issueDTO.description: Support changing it in `risingwave.toml`. In certain cases the cluster is crash looping, and because in standalone modes the faults between different nodes are not isolated as they are all embedded, the cluster can't be easily recovered.
comments:
> In certain cases the cluster is crash looping

I suppose you are referring to process panicking. Regular soft failures in streaming jobs should not affect the capability of setting system parameters with SQL interfaces.

> > In certain cases the cluster is crash looping
> 
> I suppose you are referring to process panicking. Regular soft failures in streaming jobs should not affect the capability of setting system parameters with SQL interfaces.

Yeah panic, regular soft failure will just trigger recovery, and meta + frontend should still be responsive.

Already supported.
```
[system]
pause_on_next_bootstrap = true
```

> Already supported.
> 
> ```
> [system]
> pause_on_next_bootstrap = true
> ```

Ah. Specifying system parameters through config file may only take effect on fresh cluster.

repository.description: Stream processing and management platform.
repository.name: risingwave

summary.main: Set `pause_on_next_bootstrap` on an offline cluster
summary.validationOrRequirement: Support changing `pause_on_next_bootstrap` in `risingwave.toml`
summary.attemptedFixes: Already supported
summary.otherNotes: The cluster is crash looping due to process panicking, and soft failures in streaming jobs do not affect the capability of setting system parameters with SQL interfaces. Specifying system parameters through config file may only take effect on a fresh cluster.

Hi @abhisek2004 👋

I'd love to take up this task under **GSSoC'25**!  
Kindly assign it to me, add the appropriate level and label if needed.

### 🧠 My Understanding:
This task involves building the **Announcements / Tech Feed Manager** for the Admin Panel. Admins should be able to:
- Create and publish custom announcements
- Auto-fetch tech news from NewsAPI and display them cleanly

### 💻 My Approach:

#### ??? Frontend:
- Build a new page `/admin/announcements` using **Shadcn UI** and **Tailwind CSS**
- Allow admins to:
  - Add/edit/delete announcements via form
  - Trigger fetch from NewsAPI and display preview
- Add proper **form validation**, **toast notifications**, and **loading states**
- Ensure responsiveness and route protection for `/admin/*`

#### ??? Backend:
- Create the following API routes:
  - `POST /admin/announcement` ??? to add/edit announcements
  - `GET /admin/news-feed` ??? fetch from NewsAPI, apply filtering, and return results
- Use Supabase or your preferred DB service for storing custom announcements
- Integrate NewsAPI securely using `.env` variables
- Ensure only authenticated admin users can access these endpoints

### 🔍 Testing Plan:
- Local testing for all flows (add/edit announcement, fetch tech feed)
- Secure admin-only access via JWT/auth checks
- Clean UI, no console errors, and tested with dummy data

Looking forward to contributing to DevElevate 🚀  
Let me know if you'd like a UI mock or route flow preview before I begin.

Thanks!
??? Khushboo Kataria (GSSoC???25 Contributor)

issueDTO.title: [Feature]: Fix Mobile Event Card Overflow on Smaller Screens
issueDTO.description:
### Description:
On smaller devices, the event cards overflow beyond the screen width, causing horizontal scrolling. This affects the user experience negatively, especially on phones.

### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the website on a mobile device (or emulate in browser dev tools).
2. Navigate to the event cards section.
3. Notice the horizontal scrolling or content spilling out.

### Expected Behavior:
Event cards should be fully responsive and contained within the screen width without any horizontal scrolling.

### Possible Fix:
- Use `overflow-x: hidden` on parent container if applicable.
- Use `max-width: 100%` and ensure cards use `flex-wrap` or `grid` correctly.
- Adjust `padding`/`margin` on mobile viewports using media queries.

### Tech Stack:
- React.js
- Tailwind CSS

### Additional Context:
This issue is critical for improving mobile responsiveness and usability.

issueDTO.title: Cleanup 🧹 `pipelinerunresolution_test.go` 🧹 and move mock data, status mutations and selectors to testing framework.
issueDTO.description:
## Summary

Refactor `pipelinerunresolution_test.go` a bit and move testing helpers to the new testing framework location:

- Move **all** mock data creation to `pkg/reconciler/testing/factory.go`, i.e. `var p = ..., var pts = ..., newTaskRun(), ...`
  - rename the single letter variables to proper names e.g. `p => pipeline, pts = pipelineTasks, ...`
- Move **all** status transformers to `pkg/reconciler/testing/status.go`, i.e `makeSucceed(), withCanceled()...`
- Move **all** selectors to `pkg/reconciler/testing/selectors.go`, i.e. `nopGetCustomRun, ...`

This is a good first issue.

Related issue #8906.

/help
/good-first-issue
/kind cleanup

issueDTO.title: [Good First Issue]: Align behavior of ONNX Frontend operator AveragePool-7, 10, 11, 19 with original framework
issueDTO.description:
### Context

Neural networks are graphs consisting of nodes called operators. Each operator corresponds to a mathematical function, usually described in framework's documentation or an AI standard, such as ONNX.
OpenVINO ONNX Frontend is a component responsible for working with ONNX graphs and requires implementation of different ONNX operators in order to use ONNX models.
This task requires alignment between OpenVINO ONNX Frontend and original framework implementations of AveragePool for next list of opsets: [opset 7](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-7),  [opset 10](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-10),  [opset 11](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-11),  [opset 19](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-19)
Necessary help will be provided by ONNX Fronted team.


### What needs to be done?

Operator details can be found in [ONNX Operators](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Operators.md#AveragePool)
More details can be found in ONNX Changelog: [opset 7](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-7),  [opset 10](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-10),  [opset 11](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-11),  [opset 19](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/main/docs/Changelog.md#AveragePool-19)
1. Operator already has a common implementation in OpenVINO. First of all, you need to review a documentation and prepare a table with differences between versions. It could be, for instance, a missing property, extended/reduced coverage of existing property, etc...
2. Copy existing implementation [here](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/tree/master/src/frontends/onnx/frontend/src/op) to make it aligned with original framework (extend or reduce coverage of a common implementation). Copy of modified implementation should be in a defined opset, or in opset 1 in case it implements oldest implementation. [Example of multi-opset operation](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/frontend/src/op/softmax.cpp#L50).
3. Register the function in [ops_bridge.cpp](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/frontend/src/ops_bridge.cpp#L554-L560) while keeping alphabetical order
4. Create test model(s) in [ONNX models directory](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/tree/master/src/frontends/onnx/tests/models/). OpenVINO test infrastructure then converts prototxt files to ONNX models - you will use those models later in tests
5. Add tests covering all use cases [here](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/tests/onnx_import.in.cpp)
6. Check [Python xfailed tests](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/tests/tests_python/test_backend.py) to find a test marked as a xfailed for added functionality. If any exist - remove corresponding lines and try to verify by using cmdline "python -m pytest -k name_of_test".
More details in [adding operators to ONNX Frontend guide](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/docs/how_to_add_op.md)

### Example Pull Requests

_No response_

### Resources

- [Contribution guide - start here!](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [Intel DevHub Discord channel](https://discord.gg/wPuqAujS) - engage in discussions, ask questions and talk to OpenVINO developers
- [What is OpenVINO?](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino#what-is-openvino-toolkit)
- [User documentation](https://docs.openvino.ai/)
- Guides on [ONNX Frontend architecture](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/docs/architecture.md) and [ONNX Frontend tests](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/docs/tests.md) are also available
- You can also see a [blog post on contributing to OpenVINO](https://medium.com/openvino-toolkit/how-to-contribute-to-an-ai-open-source-project-c741f48e009e)


### Contact points

@gkrivor

### Ticket

_No response_

Hi, sorry for a delay, I have a time to check github tuesday-wednesday :(

Looks like a great solution, but you touched a core part of OpenVINO, I'm not sure it is necessary.

I think you've overcomplicated the solution. Let me check. I thought about something like this, it should be enough:
https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/frontends/onnx/frontend/src/op/softmax.cpp

Currently, biggest problem which requires are alignment/refactoring is a "some common implementation" of a translation function. What does it mean? It means it looks like as an any of documented opset (for example, 7,10,11,19), but doesn't implement exact opset functionality (allows to use an undocumented input types, use wrong inputs, etc).

That's why we want to align behavior with the original documentation. Because otherwise, when you pass a model with a 19 opset it fails due to a common implementation uses wrong input (input instead of an attribute, as example), but you will get any possible error and will spend a lot of time to understand what goes wrong. I'm sure previous approach was very good for a fast implementation. But now it cause a misunderstanding while debugging and enabling new opsets.
.take

issueDTO.title: Validate the number of modes of a simulator when executing a program
issueDTO.description:
### What should be added?

**Context**

Running a program with "too many" mode on a simulator with fewer modes raises an error. However, the error is an indexing error and doesn't gracefully notify the user about the real reason of the issue.

**Example**

```py
import numpy as np
import piquasso as pq

s = 0.1

with pq.Program() as program:
    pq.Q() | pq.Vacuum()
    
    pq.Q(0, 1) | pq.ControlledZ(s)
    pq.Q(0, 1, 2) | pq.ParticleNumberMeasurement()

# Creating the Gaussian simulator
simulator = pq.GaussianSimulator(d=2, config=pq.Config(hbar=2))

# Apply the program with 10 shots.
result = simulator.execute(program, shots=10)

result.samples
```
raises:
```
File ~/software/piquasso/piquasso/_simulators/gaussian/state.py:514, in GaussianState.reduced(self, modes)
    501 def reduced(self, modes: Tuple[int, ...]) -> "GaussianState":
    502     """Returns a copy of the current state, reduced to the given `modes`.
    503 
    504     This method essentially preserves the modes specified from the representation
   (...)
    511         GaussianState: The reduced `GaussianState` instance.
    512     """
    513     return self.__class__._from_representation(
--> 514         C=self._C[np.ix_(modes, modes)],
    515         G=self._G[np.ix_(modes, modes)],
    516         m=self._m[np.ix_(modes)],
    517         config=self._config,
    518         connector=self._connector,
    519     )

IndexError: index 2 is out of bounds for axis 0 with size 2
```
whereas increasing the input argument of `GaussianSimulator` to `d=3` makes the above code execute without any errors. It would be nice to provide an informative error message when calling `simulator.execute`.
comments: Is anyone working on for this issue? If not, can I work on this?

> Is anyone working on for this issue? If not, can I work on this?

No one is working on this, and sure, I am very happy if you work on this! Reach out if you need any help!
I just opened PR #490. I would like to ask for the review, including any suggestion of feedback for the error message.

issueDTO.title: socks proxy support
issueDTO.description:
### Feature request description

Hi. I'm trying to run ramalama from China, where most of the free internet is only accessible over a proxy. Naive attempts to invoke a proxy with all_proxy fail:
```
$ export all_proxy="socks5h://localhost:1080"
```
```
$ ramalama rag ~/test.md localhost/test.md
Converting test.md.pdf .   2025-07-24 11:18:52.081 | ERROR    | fastembed.common.model_management:download_model:430 - Could not download model from HuggingFace: (ProtocolError('Connection aborted.', ConnectionResetError(104, 'Connection reset by peer')), '(Request ID: b19d6dd2-5b1f-40d3-9670-d54511639529)') Falling back to other sources.
2025-07-24 11:18:52.081 | ERROR    | fastembed.common.model_management:download_model:452 - Could not download model from either source, sleeping for 3.0 seconds, 2 retries left.
...
```

It would be great to have support for a socks proxy (actually socks5h, so that the DNS queries are also proxied).

### Suggest potential solution

_No response_

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
comments: Interested in opening a PR to add support?
I can take a look, but I don't really have an idea how it would be done best. Perhaps if all downloads were made with curl, proxies would just work, but is it sensible to change everything to curl?

> I can take a look, but I don't really have an idea how it would be done best. Perhaps if all downloads were made with curl, proxies would just work, but is it sensible to change everything to curl?

Short answer, sadly no it is not sensible to change everything to curl...
Googling this says that Python should be supporting ALL_PROXY out of the box with the http calls.
What version of RamaLama are  you using?

> What version of RamaLama are you using?

0.11.1

For me, googling shows that urllib.request needs a little bit persuasion to work with socks proxies:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63970912/urllib-request-with-socks5-proxy

A short example from an AI (not verified) is:
```python
import sockslib
import socket
import urllib.request

sockslib.set_default_proxy(('127.0.0.1', 1080))
socket.socket = sockslib.SocksSocket

html = urllib.request.urlopen('https://huggingface.co').read()
```

This works (with pysocks):
```python
import socks
import socket
import urllib.request

socks.set_default_proxy(socks.SOCKS5, 127.0.0.1, 1080)
socket.socket = socks.socksocket

resp = urllib.request.urlopen('https://ifconfig.co/ip')
print(resp.read().decode())
```

But I'm not sure how to make it work in ramalama. I tried editing https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/main/ramalama/http_client.py but without any luck yet
@ericcurtin Thoughts?

issueDTO.title: Create submodules for kernel `account` module
issueDTO.description:
Since out `kernel::account` module become fairly big, we should split it into the smaller ones by moving the storage, code and vault procedures to the dedicated submodules, leaving only the "general purpose" procedures (like `get_nonce`) in the `mod.masm`. The resulting code structure could look like so:
```text
lib/
????????? account/
???   ????????? mod.masm
???   ????????? code.masm
???   ????????? storage.masm
???   ????????? vault.masm
????????? ...
```
The procedures which will be moved to the new modules should be also re-exported from the `mod.masm` file to be still accessible with `account::*` invocation.

issueDTO.title: Create `drop_stack` procedure in `std::sys` module
issueDTO.description:
At the end of the assembly programs we frequently clean the stack to remove the overflowing values using `dropw dropw dropw dropw` instruction sequence. 

For the convenience sake we could create a new `drop_stack` procedure which would do essentially the same but in a more clean way. This procedure should be placed in the `std::sys` module and essentially being just four `dropw`s under the hood.

summary.otherNotes: At the end of assembly programs, the stack is frequently cleaned to remove overflowing values using the `dropw` instruction sequence.

issueDTO.title: Add navigation from federal subject to country
issueDTO.description:
### The feature

Add a way to navigate back up to country level from a federal subject page.

### Why?

Thanks to #351 we now have a way of adding entire pages for subjects on a level lower than country, for example for a state or bundesland. But currently, we have no easy way of navigate back up to the top, which would be good if one enters on this level and cannot use the back button.

### Examples and inspiration

_No response_
comments: Hi! I'm interested to take on the issue, but need to clarify this first. Does this feature already added in the form of button labeled as country? like in this page https://www.govdirectory.org/indonesia/Q3724/

@naufandarmawan  Like this: [https://www.govdirectory.org/united-kingdom/scotland/](https://www.govdirectory.org/united-kingdom/scotland/) In this case, there should be a navigation/back button to the [United Kingdom](https://www.govdirectory.org/united-kingdom/).
Hi! New to contributing here, interested in giving this a go with a little guidance. Having some issues building the site with snowman.

A more user-friendly alternative to a back button is implementing a breadcrumb navigation component for each page.

For example:
`Home / United Kingdom / Scotland`

In this structure, Home, United Kingdom, and Scotland act as clickable links that allow users to navigate directly to their respective pages.

Using a back button can create a confusing experience, especially if the user arrived from an unrelated page. In such cases, pressing ???Back??? might take them somewhere unexpected, whereas breadcrumbs provide clear and predictable navigation.

Breadcrumbs are interesting, but if used, should be used across all pages, not just on federal subjects. So that would be a much larger scope of work. 

As a sidenote, the logical trace would be:

`Home / Countries / United Kingdom / Scotland`

As a gut feeling, implementing breadcrumbs is overkill. I believe we just need something simple on pages for federal subjects.

Hi everyone! 
I went through the discussion, and I agree that keeping things simple (rather than full breadcrumbs) is ideal for now.

Here???s a suggestion that could work as a minimal, user-friendly solution:

1. Add a small ???Back to Country??? link/button
??? Right above the federal subject title (or near the top of the page), place a simple link like:
??? Back to United Kingdom
This is:
Clear (shows the parent country name)
Lightweight (no extra UI components needed)
Consistent (can be reused easily across similar pages)
2. Auto-generate the parent link dynamically
??? Based on the federal subject???s data, extract its country relationship (e.g., ???Scotland??? ??? ???United Kingdom???).
3. Responsive Design Consideration
??? On mobile, the link could be styled smaller or placed within a dropdown to save space.
Happy to contribute a quick prototype. Let me know your thoughts

summary.attemptedFixes: A suggestion to implement a simple 'Back to Country' link/button, auto-generate the parent link dynamically based on the federal subject's data, and consider responsive design for mobile devices.
summary.otherNotes: The feature aims to add a way to navigate back up to country level from a federal subject page, inspired by existing implementations like https://www.govdirectory.org/indonesia/Q3724/ and https://www.govdirectory.org/united-kingdom/scotland/.

issueDTO.title: TTS and STS Models to port to MLX-Audio (Roadmap)
issueDTO.description:
## Overview
This issue outlines our roadmap for integrating additional text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS) models into the MLX-Audio library to expand our offerings beyond the current Kokoro model.

## Text-to-Speech (TTS) Models

### Planned TTS Models
- [x] **Nari Labs Dia 1.6B**
- [x] **OuteTTS v1**
- [x] **Orpheus**
- [x] **BARK**
- [x] **SparkTTS 0.5B**
- [X] **Sesame CSM-1B**
- [ ] **IndexTTS**
- [ ] **MegaTTS**
- [ ] **Zonos**
- [ ] **CosyVoice2**
- [ ] **StyleTTS2**
- [ ] **Parler TTS**
- [ ] **ibm-granite/granite-speech-3.2-8b**
- [ ] **LLMVoX**
- [ ] **MeloTTS**

## Speech-to-Speech (STS) Models

### Planned STS Models
- [ ] **Kyutai-Labs Moshi**
- [ ] **Kyutai-Labs Moshi-vis**
 
## Speech-to-text (STT) 
- [x] Whisper 
- [x] Parakeet
- [x] Wav2vec
- [ ] Canary

## Technical Considerations
- All models will need MLX-specific optimizations
- Quantization support should be implemented for each model
- Documentation and examples will be created for each new model
- Performance benchmarks will be established

Instructions:
1. Select the model and comment below with your selection
2. Create a Draft PR titled: "Add support for X"
3. Read [Contribution guide](https://github.com/Blaizzy/mlx-audio/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
4. Check existing [models](https://github.com/Blaizzy/mlx-audio/tree/main/mlx_audio) 
5. Tag @Blaizzy for code reviews and questions.

## Community Input
We welcome community feedback on prioritization and additional model suggestions. Please comment on this issue with your thoughts.
comments:
As always, thanks a MILLION for all the work you do @Blaizzy.  You are a legend in the truest sense of the word 🙏   

And now, of course, I have to chime in with my own selfish requests 😄 

1. For TTS, adding on a +1 for Zonos 
2. For STS, RVC would be huge, as I run kokoro outputs through it using RVC-generated fine tunes of custom voices to basically get the best of both worlds (aka kokoro with true voice cloning).  Results are absolute 🔥 😃

Thanks a lot, it's my pleasure! 

Yes, Zonos is on the way 🚀

Could you share this RVC + Kokoro example?

I found this project through your [awesome demo](https://x.com/Prince_Canuma/status/18955219632312980070).

Would you consider supporting [StyleTTS2](https://github.com/yl4579/StyleTTS2)?

This is amazing!!!
@Blaizzy when do you sleep? VLM, now Audio?
Anyways, there's [Outes](https://github.com/edwko/OuteTTS). It's based on text LLMs, so even llama.cpp and ExLlamaV2 can run it.
Thanks!

Orpheus-TTS is just released, and it sounds really good!
https://github.com/canopyai/Orpheus-TTS
@chigkim the KING already start working on it:  https://github.com/Blaizzy/mlx-audio/pull/47

Another great sounding model: nari-labs/dia
Demo: https://yummy-fir-7a4.notion.site/dia
Github: https://github.com/nari-labs/dia
HF: https://huggingface.co/nari-labs/Dia-1.6B

Indeed @chigkim that's a great suggestion! 

@lucasnewman is working on it 🚀

Here's another good one. :)
https://github.com/resemble-ai/chatterbox
https://huggingface.co/ResembleAI/chatterbox
https://huggingface.co/spaces/ResembleAI/Chatterbox

Thanks @chigkim!

@BenLumenDigital is on it 🚀
For STT, there are also [voxtral](https://mistral.ai/news/voxtral) small and mini that seem to be quite good

issueDTO.title: Create BibEntryResource
issueDTO.description:
JabRef has a build-in http server.

Currently, the BibEntry handling is included at `org.jabref.http.server.LibraryResource`. Example: `org.jabref.http.server.LibraryResource#getPlainRepresentation`.

Task:

1. Move all `@Path("entries/{entryId}")` annotated methods to `BibEntryResource.java` (which needs to be created)
2. Add BibEntryResource to `org.jabref.http.server.Server#startServer`
3. Check that everything works using `jabsrv/src/test/rest-api.http` --> http://localhost:23119/libraries/demo/entries/Corti_2009
4. Create `BibEntryResourceTest.java` similar to `org.jabref.http.server.LibraryResourceTest`, but test BibEntry---

`@Path("entries/pdffiles")` annoted methods should be kept. We handle BibDatabaseContext and BibDatabase both in `LibraryResource` (currently).
comments: Hello , I can work on this issue
/assign-me

Happy coding! 🚀

# Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue (Docker)

## Multi-Stage Dockerfile for Web Application

This task requires creating a multi-stage Dockerfile that builds a web application and serves it using nginx.

### Requirements:

1. **Build Stage**: Use Node.js to build the application
2. **Production Stage**: Use nginx to serve the built application
3. **Optimization**: Minimize the final image size
4. **Configuration**: Set proper environment variables and nginx configuration

### Files:
- `Dockerfile` - Multi-stage Dockerfile
- `nginx.conf` - Nginx configuration file
- `README.md` - This file

### Expected Outcome:
A production-ready Docker image that efficiently builds and serves a web application. 

---
***Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!***

Issue created by ***![mrvi0](https://github.com/mrvi0)***.

## Getting Started

You can start by navigating to the folder `./task/docker/medium` and following instructions from there.

---

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

issueDTO.description:
# Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue (Solid.js)

## Create a Quote Generator App in Solid.js

In this task, you will create a simple web app for generating a quote using the Solid.js framework. This will help you learn the basic handling data fetching in Solid.js.

---
***Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!***

Issue created by ***![zshaian](https://github.com/zshaian)***.

## Getting Started

You can start by navigating to the folder ./task/solid/medium

Once you are on that folder you can then install the packages that you are going to need to run Solid.js framework, you can do so by running `npm i`

After installing the dependencies you can open the src directory and App.jsx file, and start implementing your solution!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d8587e4c-021e-43c2-8bbd-772805ae9605)

**All the CSS classes needed in this project has already been done for you in index.css and app.module.css.**

## Requirements
- Update the component based on the fetching status: loading, error, success.
- Display the current quote.
- Generate a new quote when the "New Quote" button is clicked.

If you can display the quote and its current state while fetching, and be able to generate a new quote, you are ready to make a pull request.

---
To work with this issue, you need to have npm and NodeJS installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/fork-commit-merge/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing npm and NodeJS as well as how to make a pull request.

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

**Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!**

# Fork, Commit, Merge - Easy Issue (JSON)
## Creating a JSON data file
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

### Description:

The goal of this task is to create a JSON file that stores simple data. This will be a list of users where each user has a name, email, and ID.

![json-easy](https://github.com/fork-commit-merge/fork-commit-merge/assets/82566656/7a230c45-2023-44c9-bce5-a34073a68b03)

### Acceptance Criteria:

-   The file should contain data for at least 5 users.
-   Each user should have the following fields:
    -   id: a unique identifier for each user.
    -   name: the user's name.
    -   email: the user's email address.
-   The data should be correctly formatted according to the JSON standards.

### How to get started
Open the `tasks/json/easy` directory from the root of your project.
Then open up the `users.json` file and once it is properly created according to the JSON syntax, you are done and ready to make a pull request!
*Note: You can test your JSON code in a editor like [this](https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/)*.

---

Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions and how to make a pull request.

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

#### Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!

## Create a Simple PHP Program to Concatenate Strings
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

### Description:

In `index.php` file, there are already two strings created; `$hello` and `$world`. The goal of this task is to create a simple PHP script that concatenates those two strings and prints the result to the terminal. This task will help you to get familiar with basic string operations in PHP.

-   The program must be written in PHP.
-   The program should concatenate two strings: "Hello, " and "World!".
-   The program should print the concatenated string to the terminal.

**Hint: In PHP, the `.` operator is used to concatenate strings.**

---

Start by opening the `tasks/php/easy` directory from the root of the project. 
Then open `index.php` file and start working on your solution!

To test the program, you can run `php tasks/php/easy/index.php` to see if it works as expected.

cd tasks/nextjs/easy/nextjs-easy

This project also uses TypeScript but you don't need to know any TypeScript to work with this issue. As soon as you add the sample products with names and prices, TypeScript will infer the types and all the errors present in the file will go away.

After you are done with the list, make sure you are in the `tasks/nextjs/easy/nextjs-easy` in your terminal and run `npm run dev` to start the NextJS server. Then, open "http://localhost:3000/" in your browser to check how the landing page looks.

If the product names and prices are showing up as they should, you are ready to make a pull request!

-   Your task is to create a simple card component in React that displays a random image.

Start by navigating inside of the directory used in this project with the command:
```bash
cd tasks/react/easy/react-easy
```

Then run `npm i` to install Vite, React and all the necessary dependencies for the project.

After installing the dependencies you can open the `src` directory and `App.jsx` file, and start implementing your solution!

![react-easy](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/assets/82566656/8cecb0af-abd9-477c-bd28-13381828c696)

All the CSS classes needed in this project has already been done for you in `index.css`.

Requirements:
-   Add all the components inside of the `div` that has class `center`.
-   Add `h1` tag with the text "React/Vite - Easy" in it.
-   Add a `div` with a class `card`.
-   Inside the card-div, add `img` tag with this as source: "https://loremflickr.com/320/240". It will create a random image for the card.
-   Add `h2` tag with text "Card Title" inside of it.
-   Finally, add a `p` tag with text "Card Description" in it.

After you are done with the card, make sure you are in the `tasks/react/easy/react-easy` in your terminal and run `npm run dev` to start the Vite server. Then, open "http://localhost:5173/" in your browser to check how the card looks.

If the card looks fine, you are ready to make a pull request!

---

To work with this issue, you need to have npm and NodeJS installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing npm and NodeJS as well as how to make a pull request.

---

## Why use Vite?

This React project uses Vite for near-instant server start-ups and incredibly fast hot module replacements, providing a smooth and efficient development experience.
Also Vite requires minimal setup, allowing us to focus on writing React code without getting bogged down in complex configurations.
If you want to learn more about Vite, check out the documentation:
[Vite Official Documentation](https://vitejs.dev/)

---

# Fork, Commit, Merge - Medium Issue 2 (React.js)

## Create a Traffic Light Component
*Note: You don't have ask permission to start solving the issue or get assigned, since these issues are supposed to be always open for new contributors. The actions-user bot will reset the file back to previous state for the next contributor after your commit is merged. So you can just simply start working with the issue right away!*

### How to get started:

Start by navigating inside of the directory used in this project with the command:
```bash
cd tasks/react/medium/traffic-light
```

Then run `npm i` to install Vite, React and all the necessary dependencies for the project.

After installing the dependencies you can open the `src` directory and the `TrafficLight.tsx` file, and start implementing your solution!

![react-medium](https://github.com/fork-commit-merge/fork-commit-merge/assets/82566656/e154750d-41fd-4db4-bcc6-9dd52c7e55d6)

### Description:

Create a React component using TypeScript that simulates a traffic light. The component should display three lights (red, yellow, and green) and switch between them automatically in the order of a typical traffic light sequence.

### Requirements:

-   Implement a `TrafficLight` component in `src/TrafficLight.tsx`.
-   Use TypeScript for type safety.
-   The component should render three circles, colored red, yellow, and green.
-   The traffic light should start with the red light.
-   After a few seconds, it should change to green, then yellow, and then back to red in a continuous loop.
-   Only one light should be "active" (brighter) at a time.

There are some CSS classes already added for you in the `src/App.css` file, which you can use if you like, or write your own custom CSS.
There is for example a helper pseudo-class selector for every light that is not active, which will set the light color to gray if the light does not have the `active` class:

![react-medium-css](https://github.com/fork-commit-merge/fork-commit-merge/assets/82566656/052aaf61-e4d9-40b9-8876-bf96aa2ada9c)

### Example:

The traffic light should cycle as follows:

-   Red (active) for 4 seconds.
-   Green (active) for 3 seconds.
-   Yellow (active) for 1 second.
-   Repeat the cycle.

## How to run:
After you are done with the card, make sure you are in the `tasks/react/medium/traffic-light` in your terminal and run `npm run dev` to start the Vite server. Then, open "http://localhost:5173/" in your browser to check how the app looks.

If it looks to be working fine, you are ready to make a pull request!

---

To work with this issue, you need to have npm and NodeJS installed to your local machine.
Check out [README.md](https://github.com/nikohoffren/fork-commit-merge/blob/main/README.md) for more instructions of installing npm and NodeJS as well as how to make a pull request.

---

## Why use Vite?

This React project uses Vite for near-instant server start-ups and incredibly fast hot module replacements, providing a smooth and efficient development experience.
Also Vite requires minimal setup, allowing us to focus on writing React code without getting bogged down in complex configurations.
If you want to learn more about Vite, check out the documentation:
[Vite Official Documentation](https://vitejs.dev/)

---

Feel free to ask any questions here if you have some problems!

#### Also, kindly give this project a star to enhance its visibility for new developers!
